  6189                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  6190                                  
  6191                                  ; 10/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
  6192                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSDATA:1CDAh)
  6193                                  
  6194                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6195                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  6196                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6197                                  
  6198                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  6199                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  6200                                  		;=============================================================
  6201                                  		;
  6202                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  6203                                  		;
  6204                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  6205                                  		;   ch = media byte
  6206                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  6207                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  6208                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  6209                                  
  6210                                  		; 07/04/2018
  6211                                  		;=============================================================
  6212                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  6213                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  6214                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  6215                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  6216                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  6217                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  6218                                  
  6219                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6220                                  		; Retro DOS v5.0 (IBMBIO.COM)
  6221                                  		;=============================================================
  6222                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - registers from MSLOAD section
  6223                                                  ; DL = [BootDrive]
  6224                                  		; CH = [MediaByte]
  6225                                  		; AX:BX = First data Sector
  6226                                  		; DS:SI = Original INT 1Eh table address
  6227                                  		;
  6228                                  		; Stack: INT 1Eh vector (0:78h) !not used! (dword [sp])
  6229                                  		;	 INT 1Eh table address !not used! (dword [sp+4])
  6230                                  		; DI = 78h !not used!
  6231                                   
  6232                                  		; 11/12/2023
  6233                                  		;cli	; not necessary at this stage
  6234                                  
  6235                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6236                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig_Int1Eh_Table+2], ds
  6237                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig_Int1Eh_Table], si
  6238 00001B95 1E                      		push	ds
  6239 00001B96 07                      		pop	es
  6240 00001B97 0E                      		push	cs
  6241 00001B98 1F                      		pop	ds
  6242 00001B99 8C06[141A]              		mov	[Orig_Int1Eh_Table+2], es
  6243 00001B9D 8936[121A]              		mov	[Orig_Int1Eh_Table], si
  6244                                  
  6245                                  		; 21/12/2022
  6246                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  6247                                  		;push	ax
  6248                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  6249                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  6250                                  		;pop	ax
  6251                                  
  6252                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6253                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6254                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  6255                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  6256                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  6257                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  6258                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  6259                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  6260                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6261                                  
  6262                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  6263                                  
  6264                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  6265                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  6266                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  6267                                  
  6268                                  		;mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  6269                                  		;mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  6270                                  		; 10/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  6271                                  		;mov	[cs:First_Data_Sector+2], ax
  6272                                  		;mov	[cs:First_Data_Sector], bx
  6273                                  		;mov	[cs:Boot_Drv], dl
  6274                                  		; ds = cs
  6275 00001BA1 A3[FE19]                		mov	[First_Data_Sector+2], ax
  6276 00001BA4 891E[FC19]              		mov	[First_Data_Sector], bx
  6277 00001BA8 8816[7F1A]              		mov	[Boot_Drv], dl
  6278

  6280                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  6281                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.

  6284 00001BAD 07                      		pop	es

  6301                                  		; for special names (as boot option signature)

  6304                                  				  ; (BOOT DRV's root directory the 3rd entry)
  6305                                  chk_boot_hdnoz:

  6357                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  6358                                  					; BL = foreground color (graphics modes)
  6359 00001C3F EBF2                    		jmp	short startmsg_nxt_chr
  6360                                  startmsg_ok:
  6361                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6362                                  		; ds = 0
  6363                                  
  6364                                  		; 21/12/2022

  6368                                  		;xor	cx, cx
  6369                                  		;mov	ds, cx
  6370                                  		; ds = 0
  6371

  6373                                  		; 10/12/2023

  6375                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  6376                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  6377 00001C44 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  6378                                  
  6379                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6380 00001C47 FA                      		cli
  6381                                  next_int_:		
  6382 00001C48 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  6383 00001C49 AC                      		lodsb		
  6384                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  6385 00001C4A 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  6386 00001C4B D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  6387 00001C4D D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  6388 00001C4F 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  6389 00001C51 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  6390                                  					; saving address in di
  6391 00001C53 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  6392 00001C54 AB                      		stosw
  6393 00001C55 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  6394 00001C56 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  6395 00001C57 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  6396 00001C59 E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  6397                                  		
  6398                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6399                                  		;pop	di  ; *!
  6400                                  		;pop	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  6401                                  
  6402                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  6403                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  6404                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  6405                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  6406                                  
  6407                                  		; 21/12/2022

  6409                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax

  6416                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  6417 00001C61 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  6418                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  6419 00001C65 C7065400[9907]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15

  6421                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action

  6426                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  6427 00001C75 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs

  6431 00001C79 A16800                  		mov	ax, [68h]	 ; 1Ah*4
  6432 00001C7C 8B3E6A00                		mov	di, [6Ah]	 ; 1Ah*4+2
  6433 00001C80 C7066800[AF06]          		mov	word [68h], Int1A
  6434 00001C86 8C0E6A00                		mov	[6Ah], cs
  6435

  6438 00001C8B 1F                      		pop	ds
  6439                                  
  6440                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6441 00001C8C A3[AB06]                		mov	[Orig1A], ax
  6442 00001C8F 893E[AD06]              		mov	[Orig1A+2], di
  6443                                  
  6444 00001C93 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  6445 00001C96 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  6446 00001C99 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  6447 00001C9C A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  6448                                  					; ;
  6449 00001C9F FB                      		sti
  6450 00001CA0 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  6451                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  6452                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6453                                  		;jmp	short chk_fd_count
  6454                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSDATA:1DF7h) ; *!!*
  6455                                  		; ((signature))
  6456                                  		;push	dx		; 52h ; 'R'
  6457                                  		;push	ax		; 50h ; 'P'
  6458                                  		;push	bx		; 53h ; 'S'
  6459                                  
  6460                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  6461                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  6462                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  6463                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  6464                                  ;
  6465                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  6466                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c". so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  6467                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  6468                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  6469                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  6470                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  6471                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  6472                                  
  6473                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  6474                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  6475                                  ; two dummy drives.
  6476                                  ;
  6477                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  6478                                  ; to do anything special.
  6479                                  ;
  6480                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  6481                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  6482                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  6483                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  6484                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  6485                                  ; since we already know about this.
  6486                                  
  6487                                  chk_fd_count:	; 10/12/2023
  6488                                  		;or	ax, 1	; *!!*
  6489                                  		
  6490                                  		; 12/12/2022
  6491 00001CA2 A801                    		test	al, 1
  6492                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  6493 00001CA4 7525                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  6494                                  
  6495                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  6496                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  6497                                  ;
  6498                                  ; WARNING !!!
  6499                                  ;
  6500                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  6501                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  6502                                  
  6503                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6504                                  		; ((cx is already on top of the stack))
  6505                                  		;push	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  6506                                  		;push	bx	; not necessary
  6507 00001CA6 50                      		push	ax
  6508 00001CA7 52                      		push	dx
  6509                                  		;push	di	; not necessary
  6510 00001CA8 06                      		push	es
  6511                                  
  6512 00001CA9 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6513 00001CAB B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  6514 00001CAD CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6515                                  					; DL = drive number
  6516                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6517                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6518                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6519 00001CAF 7204                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  6520                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  6521                                  		; 21/12/2022
  6522                                  		; ds = cs
  6523 00001CB1 8816[7D1A]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  6524                                  _gdskp_error:	
  6525                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6526 00001CB5 07                      		pop	es
  6527                                  		;pop	di
  6528 00001CB6 5A                      		pop	dx
  6529 00001CB7 58                      		pop	ax
  6530                                  		;pop	bx
  6531 00001CB8 59                      		pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  6532 00001CB9 7210                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  6533                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  6534                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  6535                                  		; 21/12/2022
  6536                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  6537                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  6538                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  6539 00001CBB A0[7D1A]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  6540 00001CBE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  6541 00001CC0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  6542                                  
  6543                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  6544                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6545 00001CC2 48                      		dec	ax
  6546 00001CC3 EB0A                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  6547                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6548                                  
  6549                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  6550                                  		; 21/12/2022
  6551                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  6552                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6553 00001CC5 40                      		inc	ax ; al = 1
  6554 00001CC6 A2[111A]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  6555                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  6556                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  6557                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  6558 00001CC9 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  6559                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6560                                  
  6561                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  6562 00001CCB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  6563 00001CCD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  6564                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  6565                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  6566                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6567 00001CCF 2403                    		and	al, 3
  6568 00001CD1 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  6569 00001CD3 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  6570                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  6571                                  		; 21/12/2022
  6572                                  		; ds = cs
  6573 00001CD4 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  6574                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  6575                                  notsingle:				
  6576 00001CD8 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  6577                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  6578                                  					; booted off hard file
  6579 00001CD9 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  6580                                  
  6581                                  ; 16/10/2022
  6582                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  6583                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  6584                                  BRKADR	EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  6585                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  6586                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  6587                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  6588                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  6589                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  6590                                  
  6591                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  6592                                  
  6593 00001CDB F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  6594 00001CDE 7505                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  6595 00001CE0 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  6596                                  		; 10/12/2023
  6597 00001CE2 A2[7F1A]                		mov     [Boot_Drv], al
  6598                                  gothrd:					
  6599 00001CE5 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx ; 0	; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  6600                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  6601                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  6602                                  					; ch = media byte

  6607

  6609 00001CEF 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  6610 00001CF1 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  6611                                  		
  6612                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  6613                                  
  6614 00001CF2 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  6615 00001CF4 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  6616 00001CF6 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  6617 00001CF8 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  6618 00001CFB 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  6619                                  
  6620                                  		; 21/12/2022
  6621                                  		; ds = cs
  6622 00001CFD 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  6623 00001D01 A2[AF05]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  6624                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  6625                                  					; get/save model byte
  6626 00001D04 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  6627 00001D08 A2[B005]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  6628                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  6629                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  6630 00001D0B EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  6631                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6632                                  
  6633                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  6634 00001D0D BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  6635 00001D10 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  6636                                  		; 21/12/2022
  6637 00001D12 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  6638 00001D16 A2[AF05]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  6639                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  6640                                  turn_timer_on:				
  6641 00001D19 B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  6642 00001D1B E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  6643                                  					; AKPORT

  6988                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  6989                                  ; diskette drives:
  6990                                  ;
  6991                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  6992                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  6993                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  6994                                  ;
  6995                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  6996                                  ;
  6997                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  6998                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  6999                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  7000                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  7001                                  					
  7002 00001E93 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl

  7011                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  7012                                  
  7013                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7014                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  7015                                  
  7016                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  7017                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  7018                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  7019                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  7020                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  7021                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  7022                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  7023                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  7024

  7556                                  ;******************************************************************************
  7557                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  7558                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  7559                                  ; than two diskette drives
  7560                                  ;
  7561                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  7562                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  7563                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  7564                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  7565                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  7566                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  7567                                  ;******************************************************************************

  7578                                  
  7579                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  7580                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  7581                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  7582                                  ;of their current position memory.
  7583                                  ;
  7584                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  7585                                  ;
  7586                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  7587                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  7588                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  7589                                  ;use to start with.
  7590                                  ;
  7591                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  7592                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  7593                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  7594                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  7595                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  7596

  7599                                  ;   1.	 basic configuration for msbio (endfloppy)

  7679                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  7680                                  ;
  7681                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  7682                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  7683                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  7684                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  7685                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  7686                                  ; off of it.
  7687                                  ;
  7688                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  7689                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  7690                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  7691                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  7692                                  ; when to install the hook.

  8185                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  8186                                  
  8187                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  8188                                  ;
  8189                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  8190                                  
  8191                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  8192                                  
  8193                                  ;******************************************************************************
  8194                                  ; module name: remap
  8195                                  ;
  8196                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  8197                                  ;
  8198                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  8199                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  8200                                  ;
  8201                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  8202                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  8203                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  8204                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  8205                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  8206                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  8207                                  
  8208                                  ; input:       none
  8209                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  8210                                  ; exit error:  none
  8211                                  ; called from: msinit
  8212                                  ;
  8213                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  8214                                  ;	  found in the system
  8215                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  8216                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  8217                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  8218                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  8219                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  8220                                  ;
  8221                                  ;******************************************************************************
  8222                                  
  8223                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8224                                  ; 02/10/2022
  8225                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM
  8226                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2464h)
  8227                                  		; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSDATA:1D9Eh)
  8228                                  
  8229                                  remap:		; proc near
  8230                                  
  8231                                  		; 15/12/2023
  8232                                  		; ds = cs
  8233                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  8234 00002274 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]
  8235                                  
  8236                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  8237                                  
  8238                                  drive_loop:
  8239 00002278 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  8240                                  					; first	hard disk??
  8241 0000227C 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  8242 0000227E 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  8243                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  8244 00002280 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1 ; 0FFFFh	; last bds?
  8245 00002283 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  8246 00002285 EB49                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  8247                                  
  8248                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8249                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  8250                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  8251                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8252                                  
  8253                                  fdrv_found:
  8254 00002287 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  8255                                  fdrv_loop:
  8256 00002289 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  8257 0000228C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  8258                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  8259                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  8260                                  		; 18/12/2022
  8261 0000228E 40                      		inc	ax
  8262 0000228F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  8263 00002292 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  8264                                  
  8265                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8266                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  8267                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  8268                                  ; any more.
  8269                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8270                                  
  8271                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  8272                                  		; 15/12/2023
  8273 00002294 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  8274 00002298 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  8275                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  8276                                  		;mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  8277 0000229A 8A26[2501]              		mov	ah, [dsktnum]
  8278 0000229E 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  8279                                  remap_loop1:
  8280 000022A1 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  8281                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  8282 000022A3 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  8283 000022A6 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  8284 000022A8 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  8285 000022AA 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  8286                                  
  8287                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  8288                                  
  8289                                  		; 15/12/2023
  8290                                  		;mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  8291 000022AC A0[FA19]                		mov	al, [drvfat]
  8292 000022AF 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  8293 000022B1 721D                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  8294                                  		;sub	al, [cs:dsktnum]
  8295 000022B3 2A06[2501]              		sub	al, [dsktnum]	; is it one of the other floppies?
  8296 000022B7 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  8297                                  
  8298                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  8299                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  8300                                  
  8301 000022B9 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  8302 000022BB EB04                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  8303                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8304                                  
  8305                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  8306                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  8307                                  
  8308                                  remap_boot_flop:
  8309                                  		;add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  8310                                  		; 15/12/2023
  8311 000022BD 0206[7500]              		add	al, [drvmax]
  8312                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  8313                                  		;mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  8314 000022C1 A2[FA19]                		mov	[drvfat], al
  8315 000022C4 FEC0                    		inc	al
  8316 000022C6 1E                      		push	ds
  8317 000022C7 BF0505                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  8318                                  		;mov	di, 544h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  8319                                  		;;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  8320 000022CA 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  8321 000022CC A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  8322                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  8323                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  8324 000022CF 1F                      		pop	ds ; ds = cs
  8325                                  rmap_exit:
  8326 000022D0 C3                      		retn
  8327                                  
  8328                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8329                                  
  8330                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8331                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  8332                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  8333                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  8334                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  8335                                  ;**************************************************
  8336                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  8337                                  ;
  8338                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  8339                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  8340                                  ;
  8341                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  8342                                  ;**************************************************
  8343                                  
  8344                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8345                                  bootbias equ 200h
  8346                                  
  8347                                  getboot:	; proc near
  8348                                  
  8349                                  		; 15/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 
  8350                                  		;	 (Modified PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM/IO.SYS
  8351                                  		; ds = cs
  8352                                  		
  8353                                  		; 08/04/2018
  8354                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  8355                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  8356                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8357                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  8358                                  
  8359                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  8360                                  		; 15/12/2023
  8361 000022D1 A1[041A]                		mov	ax, [init_bootseg]
  8362 000022D4 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  8363                                  
  8364                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8365 000022D6 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  8366                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  8367                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  8368 000022D9 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  8369 000022DC 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  8370 000022DE B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  8371 000022E1 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  8372                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  8373                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  8374                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  8375 000022E3 7209                    		jc	short erret
  8376                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8377 000022E5 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  8378                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  8379                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  8380 000022EC 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  8381                                  erret:
  8382 000022EE F9                      		stc
  8383                                  norm_ret:
  8384 000022EF C3                      		retn
  8385                                  
  8386                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8387                                  
  8388                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  8389                                  
  8390                                  ;***************************************************************************
  8391                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  8392                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  8393                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  8394                                  ;   determine version number
  8395                                  ;
  8396                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  8397                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  8398                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  8399                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  8400                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  8401                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  8402                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  8403                                  ;***************************************************************************
  8404                                  
  8405                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM
  8406                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:24E9h)
  8407                                  
  8408                                  sethard:	; proc near
  8409                                  		; 12/08/2023
  8410                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  8411 000022F0 57                      		push	di
  8412 000022F1 53                      		push	bx
  8413                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  8414 000022F2 06                      		push	es
  8415 000022F3 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  8416 000022F6 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  8417                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8418 000022F9 804D3F01                		or	byte [di+3Fh], 1 ; PCDOS 7.1
  8419                                  		;or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  8420                                  					; fnon_removable
  8421 000022FD C6453E05                		mov	byte [di+3Eh], 5 ; PCDOS 7.1
  8422                                  		;mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  8423                                  					; ffHardFile
  8424 00002301 C606[061A]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  8425 00002306 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  8426 00002308 52                      		push	dx
  8427 00002309 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  8428 0000230B CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8429                                  					; DL = drive number
  8430                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  8431                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  8432                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  8433                                  		;inc	dh
  8434                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  8435 0000230D 88F2                    		mov	dl, dh
  8436 0000230F B600                    		mov	dh, 0
  8437 00002311 42                      		inc	dx
  8438                                  		;mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  8439 00002312 895515                  		mov	[di+15h], dx
  8440 00002315 5A                      		pop	dx
  8441 00002316 7253                    		jc	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  8442                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8443                                  		;jc	short setret_j
  8444                                  		
  8445 00002318 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  8446 0000231B 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  8447 0000231E 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  8448 0000231F E8AFFF                  		call	getboot
  8449 00002322 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  8450 00002323 7246                    		jc	short setret
  8451                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8452                                  		;jnc	short chk_act_part
  8453                                  ;setret_j:
  8454                                  		;jmp	setret
  8455                                  
  8456                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8457                                  chk_act_part:
  8458 00002325 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx ; 0
  8459                                  		;;mov	[cs:ep_start_sector], bx
  8460                                  		;;mov	[cs:ep_start_sector+2], bx
  8461                                  		;mov	[cs:ep_hidden_secs], bx
  8462                                  		;mov	[cs:ep_hidden_secs+2], bx
  8463                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8464                                  		; ds = cs
  8465                                  		; 20/12/2023
  8466                                  		;mov	[ep_start_sector], bx
  8467                                  		;mov	[ep_start_sector+2], bx
  8468 00002327 891E[8D23]              		mov	[ep_hidden_secs], bx
  8469 0000232B 891E[8F23]              		mov	[ep_hidden_secs+2], bx
  8470                                  		
  8471 0000232F BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  8472                                  
  8473                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  8474                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  8475                                  
  8476                                  act_part:
  8477 00002332 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  8478 00002337 740B                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  8479                                  ; 16/12/2023
  8480                                  %if 0		
  8481                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8482                                  		; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4, 6, 0Bh, 0Ch, 0Eh
  8483                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; FAT12
  8484                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  8485                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4	; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  8486                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  8487                                  		
  8488                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8489                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 0Bh ; FAT32 CHS
  8490                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  8491                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 0Ch ; FAT32 LBA
  8492                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  8493                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 0Eh ; FAT16 LBA
  8494                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  8495                                  
  8496                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6	; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  8497                                  		jnz	short no_act
  8498                                  ;%else
  8499                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8500                                  		mov	al, [es:bx]	 ; partition type
  8501                                  
  8502                                  		; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4, 6, 0Bh, 0Ch, 0Eh
  8503                                  		cmp	al, 1		; FAT12
  8504                                  		je	short got_good_act
  8505                                  		cmp	al, 4		; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  8506                                  		je	short got_good_act
  8507                                  		
  8508                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8509                                  		cmp	al, 0Bh		; FAT32 CHS
  8510                                  		je	short got_good_act
  8511                                  		cmp	al, 0Ch		; FAT32 LBA
  8512                                  		je	short got_good_act
  8513                                  		cmp	al, 0Eh		; FAT16 LBA
  8514                                  		je	short got_good_act
  8515                                  
  8516                                  		cmp	al, 6		; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  8517                                  		jne	short no_act
  8518                                  %endif		
  8519                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
  8520                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  8521                                  
  8522 00002339 E83300                  		call	chk_partition_type
  8523 0000233C 7506                    		jne	short no_act
  8524                                  
  8525                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  8526 0000233E 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  8527                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  8528 00002340 744F                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  8529 00002342 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  8530                                  no_act:					
  8531 00002344 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  8532 00002347 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  8533                                  					; last entry done?
  8534 0000234B 75E5                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  8535                                  
  8536 0000234D BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  8537                                  					; restore original value of bx
  8538                                  
  8539                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  8540                                  
  8541                                  get_primary:
  8542 00002350 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  8543 00002355 750B                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  8544                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  8545                                  ; 16/12/2023
  8546                                  %if 0
  8547                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8548                                  		; see if partitiontype == 1, 4, 6, 0Bh, 0Ch, 0Eh
  8549                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1	; FAT12
  8550                                  		jz	short got_prim
  8551                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4	; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  8552                                  		jz	short got_prim
  8553                                  
  8554                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8555                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 0Bh ; FAT32 CHS
  8556                                  		jz	short got_prim
  8557                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 0Ch ; FAT32 LBA
  8558                                  		jz	short got_prim
  8559                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 0Eh ; FAT16 LBA
  8560                                  		jz	short got_prim
  8561                                  
  8562                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6	; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  8563                                  		jnz	short not_prim
  8564                                  ;%else
  8565                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8566                                  		mov	al, [es:bx]	 ; partition type
  8567                                  
  8568                                  		; see if partitiontype == 1, 4, 6, 0Bh, 0Ch, 0Eh
  8569                                  		cmp	al, 1		; FAT12
  8570                                  		je	short got_prim
  8571                                  		cmp	al, 4		; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  8572                                  		je	short got_prim
  8573                                  		
  8574                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8575                                  		cmp	al, 0Bh		; FAT32 CHS
  8576                                  		je	short got_prim
  8577                                  		cmp	al, 0Ch		; FAT32 LBA
  8578                                  		je	short got_prim
  8579                                  		cmp	al, 0Eh		; FAT16 LBA
  8580                                  		je	short got_prim
  8581                                  
  8582                                  		cmp	al, 6		; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  8583                                  		jne	short not_prim
  8584                                  %endif
  8585                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
  8586                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  8587                                  
  8588 00002357 E81500                  		call	chk_partition_type
  8589 0000235A 7506                    		jne	short not_prim
  8590                                  
  8591                                  got_prim:
  8592 0000235C 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  8593 0000235E 7431                    		jz	short set2
  8594 00002360 FECE                    		dec	dh
  8595                                  not_prim:
  8596 00002362 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  8597 00002365 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  8598 00002369 75E5                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  8599                                  setret:					
  8600 0000236B F9                      		stc			; error	return
  8601 0000236C E9C503                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  8602                                  
  8603                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8604                                  		
  8605                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
  8606                                  
  8607                                  chk_partition_type:
  8608                                  		; 16/12/2023
  8609 0000236F 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]	 ; partition type
  8610                                  
  8611                                  		; see if partitiontype == 1, 4, 6, 0Bh, 0Ch, 0Eh
  8612 00002372 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; FAT12
  8613 00002374 7412                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  8614 00002376 3C04                    		cmp	al, 4		; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  8615 00002378 740E                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  8616                                  		
  8617                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8618 0000237A 3C0B                    		cmp	al, 0Bh		; FAT32 CHS
  8619 0000237C 740A                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  8620 0000237E 3C0C                    		cmp	al, 0Ch		; FAT32 LBA
  8621 00002380 7406                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  8622 00002382 3C0E                    		cmp	al, 0Eh		; FAT16 LBA
  8623 00002384 7402                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  8624                                  
  8625 00002386 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  8626                                  chk_ptype_retn:
  8627                                  		; zf = 1 -> primary DOS partition
  8628                                  		; zf = 0 -> not a primary DOS partition
  8629 00002388 C3                      		retn
  8630                                  
  8631                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8632                                  
  8633                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
  8634                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:25B6h)
  8635                                  ep_start_sector:
  8636 00002389 00000000                		dd 0
  8637 0000238D 00000000                ep_hidden_secs:	dd 0
  8638                                  
  8639                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8640                                  
  8641                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  8642                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  8643                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  8644                                  ;
  8645                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  8646                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  8647                                  ;  without change.
  8648                                  ;
  8649                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  8650                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  8651                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  8652                                  
  8653                                  set2:		
  8654                                  		; 12/08/2023
  8655                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  8656 00002391 8816[071A]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  8657                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  8658                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  8659 00002395 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  8660 00002399 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  8661                                  
  8662                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  8663                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  8664                                  
  8665 0000239D 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  8666 000023A0 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  8667 000023A3 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  8668 000023A7 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  8669 000023AB 7305                    		jnc	short okdrive
  8670 000023AD 800E[061A]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  8671                                  
  8672                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM
  8673                                  		;;;
  8674                                  okdrive:
  8675                                  		;add	ax, [cs:ep_hidden_secs]
  8676                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:ep_hidden_secs+2]
  8677                                  		; ds = cs
  8678 000023B2 0306[8D23]              		add	ax, [ep_hidden_secs]
  8679 000023B6 1316[8F23]              		adc	dx, [ep_hidden_secs+2]
  8680 000023BA 7305                    		jnc	short okdrive_1

  9731                                  
  9732                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  9733                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  9734                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  9735                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!

  9737 00002687 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; 12 bit fat (FAT12 fs)

  9742 00002690 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus

  9744 00002694 89DE                    		mov	si, bx

  9746 00002698 01F3                    		add	bx, si		; number of FAT bytes ; 08/08/2023
  9747 0000269A 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  9748 0000269E D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)

  9752                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9753                                  
  9754                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  9755                                  
  9756                                  dobig:					
  9757 000026A5 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  9758 000026A7 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  9759 000026A8 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  9760 000026AB D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  9761 000026AD 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  9762 000026AF 5A                      		pop	dx
  9763 000026B0 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  9764 000026B3 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  9765 000026B6 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  9766                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  9767 000026B9 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  9768 000026BB 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  9769                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  9770                                  
  9771                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  9772                                  
  9773                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  9774                                  		; 27/09/2022
  9775                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  9776                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  9777                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  9778                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  9779                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  9780                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32)
  9781                                  		;   TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2;
  9782                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  9783                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  9784                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  9785                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  9786                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  9787                                  		;} else {
  9788                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);
  9789                                  		;/* there is no BPB_FATSz32 in a FAT16 BPB */
  9790                                  		;}
  9791                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  9792 000026BE 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  9793 000026C0 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  9794 000026C3 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  9795 000026C6 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  9796                                  
  9797                                  		;;;
  9798                                  		; 17/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  9799 000026C9 F606[061A]20            		test	byte [fbigfat], 20h ; fbigbig (FAT32) flag
  9800 000026CE 740D                    		jz      short dobig1
  9801                                  
  9802 000026D0 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1           ; TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2
  9803                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1+(2*TmpVal2)-1
  9804 000026D2 83E81F                  		sub	ax, 31          ; reserved sectors = 32 (for FAT32 fs) /// 1+31 = 32
  9805 000026D5 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  9806 000026D8 29D8                    		sub	ax, bx
  9807 000026DA 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0           ; dx:ax = TmpVal1+(2*TmpVal2)-TmpVal2-1
  9808                                  					;       = TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1)
  9809                                  dobig1:
  9810 000026DD 50                      		push	ax		; save lw of dividend
  9811 000026DE 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx		; divide hw of dx:ax at first (as 1st stage)
  9812 000026E0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9813 000026E2 F7F3                    		div	bx		; 32 bit division, dx:ax/bx
  9814                                  					; remainder in dx is hw of 2nd stage dividend
  9815 000026E4 89C5                    		mov	bp, ax		; hw of quotient
  9816 000026E6 58                      		pop	ax		; restore lw of dividend (of 1st stage)
  9817                                  		;;;
  9818                                  
  9819                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  9820                                  
  9821 000026E7 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  9822                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  9823 000026E9 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  9824                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9825                                  		;;;

 10274                                  		;mov	ah, 0
 10275                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10276 0000282B B8A300                  		mov	ax, 00A3h
 10277 0000282E CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - INITIALIZE USART
 10278                                  					; 	AL = initializing parameters,
 10279                                  					;	DX = port number (0-3)
 10280                                  					; Return: AH = RS-232 status code bits,
 10281                                  					;	  AL = modem status bits
