 12701                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12702                                  
 12703                                  ; 15/10/2022
 12704                                  
 12705                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
 12706                                  ;								:
 12707                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
 12708                                  ;								:
 12709                                  ;								:
 12710                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
 12711                                  ;								:
 12712                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
 12713                                  ;								:
 12714                                  ;	routine 		function			:
 12715                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
 12716                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
 12717                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
 12718                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
 12719                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
 12720                                  ;								:
 12721                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
 12722                                  ;								:
 12723                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
 12724                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
 12725                                  ;								:
 12726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
 12727                                  
 12728                                  ; convert time to ticks
 12729                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
 12730                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
 12731                                  
 12732                                  ;19/07/2019
 12733                                  ;09/03/2019
 12734                                  
 12735                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
 12736                                  
 12737                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
 12738                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
 12739                                  
 12740 000003A0 B03C                    		mov	al, 60
 12741 000003A2 F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
 12742 000003A4 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
 12743 000003A6 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
 12744 000003A8 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
 12745 000003AB 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
 12746 000003AD F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
 12747 000003AF 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
 12748 000003B1 B064                    		mov	al, 100
 12749 000003B3 F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
 12750 000003B5 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
 12751 000003B7 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
 12752 000003BA B700                    		mov	bh, 0
 12753 000003BC 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
 12754 000003BE 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
 12755                                  
 12756                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
 12757                                  
 12758 000003C1 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
 12759 000003C2 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
 12760 000003C3 BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
 12761 000003C6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
 12762 000003C8 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
 12763 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
 12764 000003CB F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
 12765 000003CD 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
 12766 000003CF 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
 12767 000003D2 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
 12768 000003D3 BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
 12769 000003D6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
 12770 000003D8 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
 12771 000003DA B500                    		mov	ch, 0
 12772 000003DC 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
 12773 000003DE 98                      		cbw
 12774 000003DF 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
 12775 000003E0 F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
 12776 000003E2 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
 12777 000003E4 CB                      		retf			; far return
 12778                                  
 12779                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12780                                  
 12781                                  ; 17/10/2022
 12782                                  ; 15/10/2022
 12783                                  
 12784                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 12785                                  ;
 12786                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
 12787                                  ;
 12788                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
 12789                                  ;
 12790                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
 12791                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
 12792                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
 12793                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
 12794                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
 12795                                  ;
 12796                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
 12797                                  ;
 12798                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
 12799                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
 12800                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
 12801                                  ;
 12802                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 12803                                  
 12804                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 12805                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:03EAh
 12806                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
 12807 000003E5 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
 12808 000003E8 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
 12809                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
 12810 000003E9 803E[8C04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
 12811                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
 12812 000003EE 7423                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
 12813 000003F0 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
 12814                                  					; get binary hours
 12815                                  					; convert to bcd
 12816                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 12817                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
 12818                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12819 000003F4 E8E800                  		call	bintobcd
 12820 000003F7 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
 12821 000003F9 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
 12822                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 12823                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
 12824 000003FD E8DF00                  		call	bintobcd
 12825 00000400 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
 12826 00000402 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
 12827                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 12828                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd
 12829 00000406 E8D600                  		call	bintobcd
 12830                                  
 12831 00000409 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
 12832 0000040B B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
 12833 0000040D FA                      		cli
 12834 0000040E B403                    		mov	ah, 3
 12835 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
 12836                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
 12837                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
 12838                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
 12839 00000412 FB                      		sti
 12840                                  no_cmos_1:				
 12841 00000413 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
 12842 00000417 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
 12843                                  		; 17/10/2022
 12844 0000041B FF1E[0606]              		call	far [ttticks]
 12845                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
 12846                                  					; convert time to ticks
 12847                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
 12848 0000041F FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
 12849 00000420 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 12850 00000422 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
 12851                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
 12852                                  					; Return: time of day set
 12853                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
 12854 00000424 8F06[8904]              		pop	word [daycnt]
 12855 00000428 FB                      		sti
 12856                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
 12857 00000429 803E[8C04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
 12858 0000042E 7409                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
 12859                                  
 12860                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12861                                  		;call	far [daycnttoday]
 12862                                  		;;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
 12863                                  					; convert to bcd format
 12864 00000430 E80700                  		call	daycnttoday
 12865                                  
 12866 00000433 FA                      		cli
 12867 00000434 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
 12868 00000436 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
 12869                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
 12870                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
 12871                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
 12872 00000438 FB                      		sti
 12873                                  no_cmos_2:
 12874                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12875                                  		; cf=0
 12876                                  		;clc
 12877 00000439 C3                      		retn
 12878                                  
 12879                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12880                                  
 12881                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 12882                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0440h
 12883                                  %if 1 
 12884                                  
 12885                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
 12886                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
 12887                                  
 12888                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
 12889                                  
 12890                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
 12891                                  ;
 12892                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
 12893                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
 12894                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
 12895                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
 12896                                  
 12897                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12898                                  
 12899                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
 12900                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
 12901 0000043A FF36[8904]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
 12902 0000043E 813E[8904]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
 12903                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
 12904 00000444 7308                    		jnb	short century20
 12905                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
 12906                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
 12907                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12908 00000446 C706[8D04]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
 12909 0000044C EB0C                    		jmp	short years
 12910                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12911                                  		
 12912                                  century20:				
 12913                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
 12914                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
 12915                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12916 0000044E C706[8D04]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
 12917 00000454 812E[8904]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
 12918                                  					; adjust daycnt
 12919                                  years:					
 12920 0000045A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 12921 0000045C A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
 12922 0000045F BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
 12923                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
 12924 00000462 F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
 12925 00000464 8916[8904]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
 12926 00000468 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
 12927 0000046A F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
 12928 0000046C 0006[8E04]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
 12929 00000470 FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
 12930                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12931 00000474 BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
 12932 00000477 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
 12933                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
 12934 0000047A 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
 12935 0000047E 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
 12936 00000480 FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
 12937                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
 12938 00000484 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
 12939                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
 12940                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12941 00000488 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365
 12942                                  regularyear:	; 20/12/2023
 12943                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
 12944 00000489 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
 12945 0000048D 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
 12946 0000048F FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
 12947                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
 12948 00000493 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
 12949 00000497 E2F0                    		loop	regularyear	; }
 12950                                  					;
 12951                                  					; should never fall through loop
 12952                                  leapyear:	
 12953 00000499 C606[9004]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
 12954                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
 12955                                  					; change month table.
 12956                                  yeardone:				
 12957 0000049E 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
 12958 000004A0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 12959 000004A2 A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
 12960                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
 12961 000004A5 BE[8F04]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
 12962                                  		;mov	cx, 12
 12963                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12964 000004A8 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
 12965                                  months:					
 12966 000004AA FEC3                    		inc	bl
 12967                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12968 000004AC 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
 12969 000004AE 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
 12970                                  					; dh=0
 12971 000004B0 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
 12972 000004B2 46                      		inc	si		; next month
 12973 000004B3 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
 12974 000004B5 E2F3                    		loop	months		;
 12975                                  					; should never fall through loop
 12976                                  month_done:	
 12977 000004B7 C606[9004]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
 12978                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
 12979                                  					; restore month table value
 12980 000004BC 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
 12981 000004BE 8A36[8E04]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
 12982 000004C2 8A0E[8D04]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
 12983 000004C6 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
 12984                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
 12985 000004C9 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
 12986 000004CB E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
 12987 000004CE 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
 12988 000004D0 E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
 12989 000004D3 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
 12990 000004D5 E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
 12991 000004D8 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
 12992 000004DA 8F06[8904]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
 12993 000004DE C3                      		retn
 12994                                  
 12995                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12996                                  
 12997                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
 12998                                  
 12999                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
 13000                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
 13001                                  		
 13002 000004DF D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
 13003 000004E1 D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
 13004                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
 13005 000004E3 C3                      		retn
 13006                                  %endif
 13007                                  
 13008                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13009                                  
 13010                                  ; 15/10/2022
 13011                                  
 13012                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13013                                  ; gettime reads date and time
 13014                                  ; and returns the following information:
 13015                                  ;
 13016                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
 13017                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
 13018                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
 13019                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
 13020                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
 13021                                  ;
 13022                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
 13023                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
 13024                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
 13025                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13026                                  
 13027                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
 13028 000004E4 E84A00                  		call	GetTickCnt
 13029 000004E7 8B36[8904]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
 13030                                  
 13031                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
 13032                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
 13033                                  ;
 13034                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
 13035                                  ;	       ----------------
 13036                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
 13037                                  ;
 13038                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
 13039                                  ;
 13040                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
 13041                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 13042                                  ;		1,193,180
 13043                                  ;
 13044                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
 13045                                  ;
 13046                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
 13047                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 13048                                  ;		59,659
 13049                                  ;
 13050                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
 13051                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
 13052                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
 13053                                  ;
 13054                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
 13055                                  ; multiply by 5
 13056                                  
 13057 000004EB 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13058 000004ED 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
 13059                                  					; multiply by 5
 13060 000004EF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13061 000004F1 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
 13062 000004F3 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13063 000004F5 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
 13064 000004F7 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
 13065 000004F9 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
 13066 000004FB 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
 13067                                  
 13068                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
 13069                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
 13070                                  
 13071 000004FC B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
 13072 000004FF F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
 13073                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
 13074                                  
 13075                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 13076                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
 13077 00000501 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
 13078 00000502 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
 13079 00000504 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
 13080                                  
 13081                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
 13082                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
 13083                                  
 13084 00000506 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
 13085 00000508 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
 13086                                  
 13087                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
 13088                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
 13089                                  
 13090 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
 13091 0000050D 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
 13092 00000510 7203                    		jb	short noadj
 13093 00000512 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
 13094                                  noadj:					
 13095 00000515 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
 13096 00000516 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
 13097                                  
 13098                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
 13099                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
 13100                                  
 13101 00000518 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
 13102 0000051A B200                    		mov	dl, 0
 13103 0000051C D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
 13104                                  		;mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
 13105                                  		; 20/12/2023
 13106 0000051E B13C                    		mov	cl, 60
 13107 00000520 F7F1                    		div	cx
 13108 00000522 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
 13109 00000524 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
 13110 00000526 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
 13111                                  
 13112                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
 13113                                  
 13114                                  		; 08/08/2023
 13115                                  		;push	ax
 13116                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
 13117 00000528 96                      		xchg	ax, si
 13118 00000529 AB                      		stosw
 13119                                  		;pop	ax
 13120 0000052A 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
 13121 0000052B AB                      		stosw
 13122 0000052C 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
 13123 0000052E AB                      		stosw
 13124 0000052F F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
 13125                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
 13126                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
 13127                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
 13128                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
 13129 00000530 C3                      		retn
 13130                                  
 13131                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13132                                  
 13133                                  ; 15/10/2022
 13134                                  
 13135                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13136                                  ;
 13137                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
 13138                                  ;
 13139                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
 13140                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
 13141                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
 13142                                  ;
 13143                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
 13144                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
 13145                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
 13146                                  ;			else
 13147                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
 13148                                  ;		}
 13149                                  ;
 13150                                  ; USES : AX
 13151                                  ;
 13152                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
 13153                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
 13154                                  ;
 13155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13156                                  
 13157                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13158                                  GetTickCnt:
 13159 00000531 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13160 00000533 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
 13161                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
 13162                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
 13163                                  					; midnight
 13164                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
 13165                                  		; 20/12/2023
 13166 00000535 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13167 00000537 3826[8B04]              		cmp	byte [t_switch], ah ; 0
 13168                                  		;cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
 13169 0000053B 7505                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
 13170                                  		;xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
 13171                                  					; and not flag
 13172 0000053D 0106[8904]              		add	[daycnt], ax
 13173 00000541 C3                      		retn
 13174                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13175                                  
 13176                                  inc_case:
 13177 00000542 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13178 00000544 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
 13179 00000546 FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]
 13180                                  no_rollover:
 13181 0000054A C3                      		retn
 13182

 13184                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 13224                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 13225                                  ;	disk interface routines
 13226                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 13227                                  
 13228                                  ; device attribute bits:
 13229                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
 13230                                  
 13231                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
 13232                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
 13233                                  
 13234                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
 13235                                  
 13236                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
 13237                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
 13238                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
 13239                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
 13240                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
 13241                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
 13242                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
 13243                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
 13244                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
 13245                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
 13246                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
 13247                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
 13248                                  ; we reset the counter.
 13249                                  
 13250                                  accessmax	equ	5
 13251                                  
 13252                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
 13253                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
 13254                                  ;
 13255                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
 13256                                  ;   if it is 0, then
 13257                                  ;	set slow = 15
 13258                                  ;   else
 13259                                  ;	set slow = value
 13260                                  ;   ...
 13261                                  ;*********************************************
 13262                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
 13263                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
 13264                                  ;*	 use slow
 13265                                  ;*   else
 13266                                  ;*	 use fast
 13267                                  ;*********************************************
 13268                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
 13269                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
 13270                                  ;	use slow
 13271                                  ;   else
 13272                                  ;	use fast
 13273                                  ;   ...
 13274                                  ;   restore current head settle value
 13275                                  ;
 13276                                  ;
 13277                                  ;---------------------------------------
 13278                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
 13279                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
 13280                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
 13281                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
 13282                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
 13283                                  
 13284                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
 13285                                  
 13286                                  ; 15/10/2022
 13287                                  
 13288                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13289

 13371                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13372                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 13373                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 13374                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
 13375                                  ;
 13376                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
 13377                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13378                                  
 13379                                  SetDrive:
 13380                                  		;les	di, dword ptr ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds
 13381 000005A4 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
 13382                                  X_Scan_Loop:
 13383 000005A8 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
 13384 000005AC 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
 13385 000005AE 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
 13386 000005B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13387 000005B4 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
 13388 000005B6 F9                      		stc
 13389                                  X_SetDrv:
 13390 000005B7 C3                      		retn

 13396                                  	; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
 13397                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05C2h
 13398                                  
 13399                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 13400                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
 13401                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
 13402                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
 13403                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
 13404                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 13405                                  
 13406                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
 13407 000005B8 E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
 13408 000005BB BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
 13409                                  		; 21/12/2023

 13496                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13497                                  
 13498                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13499                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 13500                                  ; drive.
 13501                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 13502                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 13503                                  ; returns in si:
 13504                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 13505                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 13506                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 13507                                  ;
 13508                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 13509                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13510                                  
 13511                                  		; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 IBMBIO.COM
 13512                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13513                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 13514 0000062A BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 13515 0000062D E801FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 13516                                  		; 21/12/2023
 13517 00000630 268B4579                		mov	ax, [es:di+79h]
 13518                                  		;mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 13519                                  					; get stored time
 13520 00000634 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 13521                                  		; 21/12/2023
 13522 00000636 268B457B                		mov	ax, [es:di+7Bh]
 13523                                  		;mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 13524 0000063A 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 13525                                  		; 11/08/2023
 13526                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 13527                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 13528 0000063C 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 13529 0000063E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 13530 00000640 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 13531                                  		; 11/08/2023
 13532                                  		;inc	al
 13533                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 13534                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 13535                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5
 13536                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 13537                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 13538                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 13539                                  		; 11/08/2023
 13540                                  		;dec	al
 13541                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 13542                                  		; 11/08/2023
 13543 00000642 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 13544 00000647 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 13545 00000649 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 13546 0000064D C3                      		retn
 13547                                  
 13548                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13549                                  
 13550                                  timepassed:
 13551 0000064E 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 13552                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 13553 00000651 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 13554                                  
 13555                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 13556                                  timecheck_unk:
 13557 00000653 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 13558                                  timecheck_ret:
 13559                                  		; 11/08/2023
 13560                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
 13561 00000654 C3                      		retn

 13737                                  
 13738                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023 - Erdogan Tan)
 13739                                  			;; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 13740                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 13741                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 13742                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 13743                                  			; at the BDS offset 59 but current (this) code checks flags
 13744                                  			; at ES:DI+59 while DI points the BDS offset 136!? ; (PCDOS 7.1)
 13745                                  			;; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 13746                                  			;; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!? ; (MSDOS 6.22)
 13747                                  			;
 13748                                  			; Correct Code:
 13749                                  			; ;test byte [ES:59],20h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbigbig  ; (PCDOS 7.1)	
 13750                                  			; ;;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig  ; (MSDOS 6.22)
 13751                                  			; 11/09/2023
 13752                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 13753                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 13754                                  			;
 13755                                  			; Same BUG is existing in MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh
 13756                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 13757                                  
 13758                                  			;
 13759                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 13760                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 13761                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 13762                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 13763

 13810                                  ; 15/10/2022
 13811                                  
 13812                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13813                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 13814                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 13815                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 13816                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 13817                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 13818                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 13819                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 13820                                  ;
 13821                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 13822                                  ;
 13823                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 13824                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 13825                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 13826                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 13827                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 13828                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 13829                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 13830                                  ;
 13831                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 13832                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 13833                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 13834                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 14068                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14069                                  
 14070                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14071                                  
 14072                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 14073                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 14074                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 14075                                  ;
 14076                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 14077                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 14078                                  
 14079                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14080                                  
 14081                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 14082                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 14083                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)) ; 22/12/2023
 14084                                  
 14085                                  ; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 14086                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSCODE:07C6h)
 14087                                  
 14088                                  readbootsec:	
 14089 000007B2 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 14090 000007B4 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 14091 000007B7 E8FC00                  		call	read_sector
 14092 000007BA 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 14093 000007BC 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 14094                                  
 14095                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 14096                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 14097                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 14098                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 14099                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 14100                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 14101                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 14102                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 14103                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 14104                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 14105                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 14106                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 14107                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 14108                                  		; informations
 14109                                  
 14110                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 14111                                  
 14112                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14113                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14114                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 14115                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 14116                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 14117                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 14118                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 14119                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 14120                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 14121                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 14122                                  
 14123                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14124 000007BE A0[5201]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 14125 000007C1 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 14126 000007C3 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 14127                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 14128 000007C5 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 14129 000007C7 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 14130                                  					; no need for nop
 14131 000007C9 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 14132 000007CB 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 14133 000007CD 803E[5401]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 14134 000007D2 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 14135                                  
 14136                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14137                                  ;
 14138                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 14139                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 14140                                  ;;
 14141                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 14142                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 14143                                  ;;
 14144                                  ;;check_signature:
 14145                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 14146                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 14147                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 14148                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 14149                                  
 14150                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 14151                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 14152                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 14153                                  
 14154                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14155                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 14156 000007D4 A0[6701]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 14157                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 14158 000007D7 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 14159 000007D8 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 14160 000007DA 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 14161 000007DC 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 14162 000007DD 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 14163                                  
 14164                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 14165                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 14166                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 14167                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 14168                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 14169                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 14170                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 14171                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 14172                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 14173                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 14174                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 14175                                  
 14176                                  checksinglesided:
 14177                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 14178                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14179                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 14180 000007DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 14181 000007E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 14182 000007E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
 14183 000007E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 14184 000007E7 813E[5A01]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 14185 000007ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 14186 000007EF 803E[5C01]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 14187 000007F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 14188                                  
 14189                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 14190                                  
 14191                                  mustbeearlier:				
 14192 000007F6 C606[5F01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 14193                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 14194 000007FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 14195                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14196                                  
 14197                                  invalidbootsec:				
 14198 000007FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 14199                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14200                                  movbpb_ret:
 14201                                  gooddsk:				
 14202 000007FE F8                      		clc
 14203                                  err_ret:
 14204 000007FF C3                      		retn
 14205                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14206                                  
 14207                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14208                                  ;err_ret:				
 14209                                  		;retn
 14210                                  
 14211                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14212                                  
 14213                                  ; 15/10/2022
 14214                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14215                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 14216                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 14217                                  ;
 14218                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 14219                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 14220                                  ; the boot record. after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 14221                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 14222                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 14223                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 14224                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14225                                  
 14226                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14227                                  
 14228                                  ; 22/12/2023
 14229                                  %if 0
 14230                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14231                                  movbpb:
 14232                                  		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 14233                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 14234                                  					; sectors per unit
 14235                                  		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 14236                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 14237                                  					; number of directory entries
 14238                                  		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 14239                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 14240                                  					; size of drive
 14241                                  		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 14242                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 14243                                  					; media	descriptor
 14244                                  		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 14245                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 14246                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 14247                                  		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 14248                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 14249                                  					; sectors per track
 14250                                  		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 14251                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 14252                                  					; number of heads
 14253                                  %else
 14254                                  		; 29/12/2023
 14255                                  		; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 14256                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSCODE:0814h)
 14257                                  		;;;
 14258                                  movbpb:
 14259 00000800 57                      		push	di
 14260 00000801 83C706                  		add	di, 6		; BDS+6 = BDS.BPB
 14261 00000804 8D36[5D01]              		lea	si, [disksector+0Bh]
 14262 00000808 B93500                  		mov	cx, 53		; copy bios parameters block
 14263                                  					; from BPB_BytsPerSec to (FAT32) BS_DrvNum (excluded)
 14264 0000080B FC                      		cld
 14265 0000080C F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14266 0000080E 8B4CD3                  		mov	cx, [si-45]	; si = disksector+64 -> 64-45 = 19
 14267                                  					; disksektor+19 = BPB_TotSec16
 14268 00000811 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
 14269 00000813 E308                    		jcxz	movbpb_bigdisk
 14270 00000815 26894DE0                		mov	[es:di-32], cx	; write 16 bit total sectors
 14271                                  					; to 32 bit total sectors field
 14272 00000819 268945E2                		mov	[es:di-30], ax	; BPB_TotalSec32+2 (BDS offset 29, BPB offset 23)
 14273                                  movbpb_bigdisk:
 14274 0000081D 3944D6                  		cmp	[si-42], ax     ; BPB_FATSz16 = disksector+22
 14275 00000820 7410                    		jz	short movbpb_fat32
 14276                                  movbpb_fat:
 14277 00000822 83EF1C                  		sub	di, 28		; di = BDS offset 31 (BPB offset 25)
 14278                                  		; 29/12/2023
 14279 00000825 B90C00                  		mov	cx, 12		; clear 12 byte extended BDS (FAT32) fields
 14280                                  					; (which are used only for FAT32 disks)
 14281 00000828 F3AA                    		rep stosb
 14282 0000082A 48                      		dec	ax		; -1 ; 0FFFFh
 14283 0000082B AB                      		stosw			; set BDS offset 43 (dword) to -1
 14284                                  					; dword [BDS.BPB_FSInfo] = 0FFFFFFFFh
 14285 0000082C AB                      		stosw
 14286 0000082D 40                      		inc	ax		; ax = 0
 14287 0000082E B10C                    		mov	cl, 12		
 14288                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; clear BDS offset 47 to 59
 14289                                  					; (BPB offset 41 to 53) (disksector offset 52 to 64)
 14290 00000830 F3AA                    		rep stosb
 14291                                  movbpb_fat32:
 14292 00000832 5F                      		pop	di
 14293                                  %endif
 14294                                  		;;;
 14295                                  
 14296 00000833 803E[9B04]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 14297 00000838 75C4                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 14298 0000083A E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 14299 0000083D 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 14300 0000083F C606[9B04]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 14301                                  movbpb_conv:
 14302 00000844 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 14303 00000849 75B3                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 14304 0000084B E83B14                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 14305                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14306                                  		; cf = 0

 14308                                  		;clc
 14309 0000084E C3                      		retn
 14310                                  		
 14311                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14312                                  
 14313                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 14314                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 14315                                  ;by es:di.
 14316                                  
 14317                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 14318                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 14319                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 14320                                  ;      the boot record information.
 14321                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 14322                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 14323                                  
 14324                                  ; 22/12/2023
 14325                                  %if 0
 14326                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14327                                  mov_media_ids:		
 14328                                  		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 14329                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 14330                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 14331                                  		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 14332                                  		push	cx
 14333                                  		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 14334                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 14335                                  		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 14336                                  		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 14337                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 14338                                  		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 14339                                  		push	di
 14340                                  		push	si
 14341                                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 14342                                  		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 14343                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 14344                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 14345                                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 14346                                  		rep movsb
 14347                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 14348                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14349                                  		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 14350                                  		mov	si, disksector+36h
 14351                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 14352                                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 14353                                  		rep movsb
 14354                                  		pop	si
 14355                                  		pop	di
 14356                                  		pop	cx
 14357                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14358                                  		; cf = 0
 14359                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 14360                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 14361                                  		retn
 14362                                  %else
 14363                                  		; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 14364                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSCODE:0865h)
 14365                                  		;;;		
 14366                                  mov_media_ids:

 14368 00000854 7507                    		jnz	short mmi_chk_fat
 14369 00000856 803E[9401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+42h], 29h
 14370                                  					; [disksector+FAT32_EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 14371                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 14372 0000085B EB05                    		jmp	short mmi_chk_fat32
 14373                                  mmi_chk_fat:
 14374 0000085D 803E[7801]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 14375                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 14376                                  mmi_chk_fat32:

 14379 00000865 50                      		push	ax

 14381 00000867 56                      		push	si
 14382 00000868 1E                      		push	ds
 14383 00000869 833E[6801]00            		cmp	word [disksector+16h], 0 ; BPB.FATSz16

 14427                                  
 14428                                  ; 15/10/2022
 14429                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 14430                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 14431                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 14432                                  ; output:
 14433                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 14434                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 14435                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 14436                                  
 14437                                  readfat:	
 14438                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 14439                                  		; 10/12/2022

 14441 000008AB B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 14442                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 14443 000008AE E80500                  		call	read_sector
 14444 000008B1 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret

 14446                                  bad_fat_ret:

 14449                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14450                                  
 14451                                  ; 15/10/2022
 14452                                  
 14453                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14454                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 14455                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 14456                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 14457                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 14458                                  ;		dh has head
 14459                                  ;		es:di has bds
 14460                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 14461                                  ;
 14462                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 14463                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 14464                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 14465                                  ;
 14466                                  ;		carry set
 14467                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 14468                                  ;
 14469                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 14470                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14471                                  
 14472                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14473                                  ; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 14474                                  
 14475                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14476                                  read_sector:
 14477 000008B6 55                      		push	bp
 14478 000008B7 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 14479 000008BA 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14480 000008BE BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 14481                                  rd_ret:
 14482 000008C1 06                      		push	es
 14483 000008C2 1E                      		push	ds
 14484 000008C3 07                      		pop	es
 14485 000008C4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 14486 000008C7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 14487                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 14488                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 14489                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 14490 000008C9 07                      		pop	es
 14491 000008CA 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 14492                                  rd_rty:
 14493 000008CC E81105                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 14494 000008CF 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 14495                                  
 14496                                  		; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 14497 000008D1 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1

 14499                                  		;;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]

 14506 000008E1 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 14507                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 14508                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 14509                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 14510                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14511 000008E5 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 14512 000008E7 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 14513                                  		; 
 14514 000008EA 1F                      		pop	ds
 14515 000008EB A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 14516 000008EE 58                      		pop	ax
 14517                                  rd_skip1_dpt:
 14518 000008EF 06                      		push	es
 14519 000008F0 1E                      		push	ds
 14520 000008F1 07                      		pop	es
 14521 000008F2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 14522 000008F5 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 14523                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 14524                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 14525                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 14526 000008F7 07                      		pop	es
 14527 000008F8 9C                      		pushf
 14528 000008F9 803E[A905]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 14529 000008FE 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt

 14531 00000901 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 14532 00000904 1E                      		push	ds
 14533 00000905 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]

 14680 00000977 50                      		push	ax
 14681 00000978 53                      		push	bx

 14684                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
