 18575                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 18576                                  
 18577                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18578                                  
 18579                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18580                                  ;
 18581                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 18582                                  ;
 18583                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 18584                                  ;							seg ffff )
 18585                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 18586                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 18587                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 18588                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 18589                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 18590                                  ;
 18591                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 18592                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 18593                                  ;
 18594                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18595                                  
 18596                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18597                                  HMAPtr:
 18598 0000172B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 18599                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 18600 00001730 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 18601                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 18602 00001734 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 18603 00001737 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 18604 00001739 803E[DD07]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 18605                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 18606 0000173E 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 18607 00001740 FF1E[D907]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 18608                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 18609 00001744 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 18610                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 18611                                  HMAPtr_retn:
 18612 00001748 C3                      		retn
 18613                                  
 18614                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 18615                                  
 18616                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18617                                  
 18618                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 18619                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 18620                                  
 18621                                  move_sector:
 18622                                  
 18623                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 18624                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 18625                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 18626                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 18627                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 18628                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 18629                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 18630                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 18631                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 18632                                  ;
 18633                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 18634                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 18635                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 18636                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 18637                                  ; back to a byte move.
 18638                                  
 18639 00001749 FC                      		cld
 18640 0000174A 51                      		push	cx
 18641 0000174B B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 18642 0000174E 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 18643 00001752 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 18644 00001754 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 18645 00001758 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 18646 0000175A F3A5                    		rep movsw
 18647 0000175C 59                      		pop	cx
 18648 0000175D C3                      		retn
 18649                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18650                                  
 18651                                  movsec_bytes:
 18652 0000175E D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 18653 00001760 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 18654 00001762 59                      		pop	cx
 18655 00001763 C3                      		retn
 18656                                  
 18657                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 18658                                  
 18659                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18660                                  
 18661                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 18662                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 18663                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 18664                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 18665                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 18666                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 18667                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 18668                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 18669                                  ;
 18670                                  ; input conditions:
 18671                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 18672                                  ;
 18673                                  ; output:
 18674                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 18675                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 18676                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 18677                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 18678                                  
 18679                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS 5.0
 18680                                  check_wrap:	
 18681 00001764 50                      		push	ax
 18682 00001765 53                      		push	bx
 18683 00001766 06                      		push	es
 18684 00001767 57                      		push	di
 18685 00001768 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 18686 0000176B 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 18687                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18688 0000176D 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 18689                                  		; 12/12/2022
 18690                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 18691                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 18692 00001772 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 18693 00001774 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 18694 00001778 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 18695 0000177A 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 18696 0000177D 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 18697 0000177F 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 18698 00001781 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 18699                                  
 18700                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 18701                                  ; last sector on that track.
 18702                                  
 18703 00001783 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 18704 00001785 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 18705                                  		; 18/12/2022
 18706 00001787 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 18707 00001788 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 18708                                  					; if on	boundary
 18709                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 18710                                  not_on_bound:
 18711 0000178A 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 18712 0000178D 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 18713 0000178F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 18714 00001791 40                      		inc	ax
 18715 00001792 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 18716 00001794 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 18717                                  		; 02/09/2023
 18718 00001797 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 18719 0000179B 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 18720                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 18721                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 18722 0000179D 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 18723 0000179F 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 18724 000017A0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 18725                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 18726 000017A2 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 18727                                  
 18728                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 18729                                  
 18730 000017A4 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 18731 000017A6 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 18732 000017A8 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 18733                                  
 18734                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 18735                                  
 18736 000017AA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 18737 000017AC 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 18738 000017AE 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 18739                                  no_head_bound:				
 18740 000017AF 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 18741 000017B1 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 18742 000017B2 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 18743 000017B4 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 18744 000017B6 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 18745 000017B8 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 18746 000017BB B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 18747 000017BD 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 18748 000017BF D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 18749 000017C1 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 18750 000017C3 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 18751 000017C5 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 18752 000017C7 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 18753 000017C9 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 18754                                  no_wrap:				
 18755 000017CB F8                      		clc
 18756 000017CC 5F                      		pop	di
 18757 000017CD 07                      		pop	es
 18758 000017CE 5B                      		pop	bx
 18759 000017CF 58                      		pop	ax
 18760 000017D0 C3                      		retn
 18761                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18762                                  
 18763                                  no_wrap_head:				
 18764 000017D1 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 18765 000017D3 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 18766 000017D5 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 18767                                  
 18768                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 18769                                  
 18770                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18771                                  
 18772                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 18773                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 18774                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 18775                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 18776                                  ;
 18777                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 18778                                  
 18779                                  		; 19/10/2022
 18780                                  find_bds:	
 18781 000017D7 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 18782                                  fbds_1:					
 18783 000017DB 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 18784 000017DF 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 18785 000017E1 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 18786                                  					; go to next bds
 18787 000017E4 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 18788 000017E7 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 18789 000017E9 F9                      		stc
 18790                                  fdbs_2:					
 18791 000017EA C3                      		retn
 18792                                  
 18793                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 18794                                  
 18795                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18796                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18797                                  doint:
 18798                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18799 000017EB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18800                                  					; get physical drive number
 18801                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 18802                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 18803                                  		
 18804 000017EE 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 18805 000017F0 08C0                    		or	al, al
 18806 000017F2 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 18807                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18808 000017F4 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 18809                                  					; get request code
 18810                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 18811 000017F7 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 18812                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 18813 000017FA 9D                      		popf
 18814                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 18815                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18816 000017FB 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18817                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 18818                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18819 00001800 9C                      		pushf
 18820                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18821 00001801 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 18822                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 18823                                  dointdone:				
 18824 00001804 C3                      		retn
 18825                                  
 18826                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18827                                  
 18828                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18829                                  
 18830                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 18831                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 18832                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 18833                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 18834                                  ;
 18835                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 18836                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 18837                                  ;
 18838                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 18839                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 18840                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 18841                                  
 18842                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 18843                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 18844                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 18845                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 18846                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 18847                                  ;.olddx: resw
 18848                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 18849                                  ;.olddd: resd
 18850                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 18851                                  ;end struc
 18852                                  
 18853                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18854                                  
 18855                                  ;   entry conditions:
 18856                                  ;	ah = function
 18857                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 18858                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 18859                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 18860                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 18861                                  ;   output conditions:
 18862                                  ;	no dma violation.
 18863                                  
 18864                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 18865                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 18866                                  ;
 18867                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 18868                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 18869                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 18870                                  
 18871                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18872                                  
 18873                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18874                                  
 18875                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18876                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1889h
 18877                                  dtype_array:
 18878 00001805 90004000                		dd 400090h		; 40h:90h is drive type array addr
 18879                                  
 18880                                  ; 17/10/2022
 18881                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18882                                  ; 09/12/2022
 18883                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 18884                                  
 18885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18886                                  
 18887                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 18888                                  
 18889                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 18890                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 18891                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 18892                                  
 18893                                  format_special_stuff:
 18894 00001809 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 18895 0000180E 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 18896 00001810 53                      		push	bx
 18897 00001811 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 18898 00001814 E85104                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 18899 00001817 5B                      		pop	bx
 18900 00001818 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 18901                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18902                                  
 18903                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18904                                  
 18905                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 18906                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 18907                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 18908                                  
 18909                                  		; 19/10/2022
 18910                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 18911 0000181A 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 18912 0000181C 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 18913 0000181E 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 18914 0000181F 51                      		push	cx
 18915 00001820 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 18916 00001822 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 18917 00001824 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 18918 00001826 8406[A204]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 18919 0000182A 59                      		pop	cx
 18920 0000182B 58                      		pop	ax
 18921 0000182C 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 18922                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 18923 0000182E 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 18924 0000182F 06                      		push	es
 18925                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18926 00001830 2EC41E[0518]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 18927                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 18928                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 18929 00001835 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 18930 00001837 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 18931 0000183A 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 18932                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 18933                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 18934 0000183E 07                      		pop	es
 18935 0000183F 5B                      		pop	bx
 18936 00001840 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 18937                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18938                                  
 18939                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18940                                  
 18941                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 18942                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 18943                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 18944                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 18945                                  
 18946                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 18947 00001842 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 18948                                  					; read driver parm ?
 18949 00001847 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 18950 00001849 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 18951                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 18952 0000184E 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 18953                                  ps2_30_problem:
 18954 00001850 50                      		push	ax
 18955 00001851 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 18956                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18957                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18D7h
 18958                                  		;		 ; call BIOSDATA:call_orig13	
 18959                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 18960                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18961 00001853 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18962                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 18963                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18964 00001858 58                      		pop	ax
 18965 00001859 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 18966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18967                                  
 18968                                  ; 17/10/2022
 18969                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18970                                  
 18971                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 18972                                  
 18973                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 18974                                  
 18975                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 18976                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 18977                                  
 18978                                  		; 19/10/2022
 18979 0000185B 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 18980                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 18981                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 18982 0000185C 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 18983                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 18984                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 18985                                  
 18986                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 18987                                  
 18988 00001861 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 18989 00001864 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 18990 00001867 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 18991                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 18992                                  format_special_stuff_done:
 18993 00001869 803E[A204]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 18994 0000186E 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 18995                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 18996                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 18997                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18998                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18EDh
 18999                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 19000 00001870 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 19001                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 19002                                  		
 19003 00001875 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 19004                                  		
 19005 00001876 803E[AF05]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 19006                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 19007 0000187B 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 19008                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 19009                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 19010 0000187D 9D                      		popf
 19011 0000187E 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 19012                                  ret_from_i13:
 19013 00001880 1F                      		pop	ds
 19014 00001881 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 19015                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19016                                  
 19017                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 19018                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 19019                                  ; a changeline error.
 19020                                  
 19021                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 19022 00001884 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 19023                                  i13_ret_error:				
 19024 00001886 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 19025 00001889 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 19026 0000188B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 19027 0000188D 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 19028 0000188F 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 19029 00001894 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 19030                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 19031                                  					; never	would
 19032 00001896 53                      		push	bx
 19033 00001897 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 19034 0000189A E8CB03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 19035 0000189D 5B                      		pop	bx
 19036                                  int13b:
 19037 0000189E F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 19038 0000189F EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 19039                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19040                                  
 19041                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 19042                                  
 19043                                  goterr13:
 19044 000018A1 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 19045 000018A4 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 19046                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 19047 000018A6 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 19048 000018A9 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 19049 000018AB 803E[A905]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 19050 000018B0 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 19051                                  
 19052 000018B2 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 19053                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 19054                                  					; (2 = romread)
 19055                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 19056 000018B7 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 19057                                  
 19058 000018B9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 19059                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 19060                                  		; 17/10/2022
 19061 000018BB 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 19062                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 19063                                  					; call far 70:797h
 19064 000018C0 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 19065 000018C3 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 19066 000018C5 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 19067 000018C7 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 19068 000018C9 53                      		push	bx
 19069 000018CA 51                      		push	cx
 19070 000018CB 52                      		push	dx
 19071 000018CC A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 19072                                  loop_ecc:
 19073 000018CF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 19074                                  
 19075                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 19076                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 19077                                  ;
 19078                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 19079                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 19080                                  ; track.
 19081                                  ;
 19082                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 19083                                  ; this request.
 19084                                  ;
 19085                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 19086                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 19087                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 19088                                  ;
 19089 000018D2 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 19090                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 19091                                  		; 17/10/2022
 19092 000018D5 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 19093                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 19094 000018DA 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 19095 000018DC 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 19096 000018DF 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 19097 000018E1 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 19098 000018E4 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 19099                                  		; 10/12/2022
 19100                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 19101                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 19102 000018E6 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 19103                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 19104                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 19105                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 19106                                  ok11_op:
 19107 000018E8 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 19108 000018EC 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 19109 000018EE FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 19110                                  					; add 200h to address
 19111 000018F0 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 19112 000018F2 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 19113 000018F4 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 19114                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19115                                  
 19116                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 19117                                  
 19118                                  ok11_exit_err:
 19119 000018F6 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 19120                                  ok11_exit:
 19121 000018F7 5A                      		pop	dx
 19122 000018F8 59                      		pop	cx
 19123 000018F9 5B                      		pop	bx
 19124 000018FA EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 19125                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19126                                  
 19127                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 19128                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 19129                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 19130                                  
 19131                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 19132 000018FC 06                      		push	es
 19133 000018FD 53                      		push	bx
 19134 000018FE BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 19135 00001901 1E                      		push	ds
 19136 00001902 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 19137 00001903 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 19138                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 19139                                  		; 17/10/2022
 19140 00001906 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 19141                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 19142 0000190B 5B                      		pop	bx
 19143 0000190C 07                      		pop	es
 19144 0000190D 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 19145 0000190F 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 19146 00001912 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 19147                                  
 19148                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 19149                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 19150                                  
 19151                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 19152 00001914 56                      		push	si
 19153 00001915 57                      		push	di
 19154 00001916 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 19155 00001918 BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 19156 0000191B E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 19157 0000191E 5F                      		pop	di
 19158 0000191F 5E                      		pop	si
 19159 00001920 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 19160                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19161                                  
 19162                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 19163                                  ; operation as best we can.
 19164                                  
 19165                                  gotdmaerr:
 19166 00001922 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 19167 00001925 FB                      		sti
 19168 00001926 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 19169 00001929 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 19170                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 19171                                  					; functions we don't handle
 19172 0000192B 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 19173 0000192E 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 19174 00001930 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 19175 00001933 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 19176 00001935 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 19177                                  
 19178                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 19179                                  
 19180                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 19181                                  
 19182 00001937 52                      		push	dx
 19183 00001938 51                      		push	cx
 19184 00001939 53                      		push	bx
 19185 0000193A 50                      		push	ax
 19186 0000193B 55                      		push	bp
 19187 0000193C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 19188 0000193E 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 19189                                  		; 26/12/2023
 19190                                  		;add	dx, dx
 19191                                  		;add	dx, dx
 19192                                  		;add	dx, dx
 19193                                  		;add	dx, dx		; dx = dx*16
 19194 00001940 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 19195 00001942 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 19196 00001944 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 19197 00001946 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 19198 00001948 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 19199 0000194A 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 19200                                  
 19201                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 19202                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 19203                                  
 19204 0000194E 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 19205 00001950 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 19206                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19207                                  
 19208                                  no_skip_first:
 19209 00001953 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 19210 00001955 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 19211 00001957 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 19212                                  
 19213                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 19214                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 19215                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 19216                                  ;
 19217                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 19218                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 19219                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 19220                                  ; in error.
 19221                                  
 19222 00001959 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 19223 0000195B 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 19224                                  
 19225                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 19226                                  
 19227 0000195D 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 19228                                  					; set up head number
 19229 00001960 E888FE                  		call	doint
 19230 00001963 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 19231                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19232                                  
 19233                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 19234 00001966 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 19235 00001968 F9                      		stc
 19236 00001969 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 19237                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 19238                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19239                                  
 19240                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 19241                                  
 19242                                  intverify:
 19243 0000196C 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 19244 0000196D 53                      		push	bx
 19245 0000196E 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 19246 0000196F 07                      		pop	es
 19247                                  dosimple:
 19248 00001970 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 19249                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 19250                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 19251                                  		; 17/10/2022
 19252 00001973 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 19253                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 19254 00001978 5B                      		pop	bx
 19255 00001979 07                      		pop	es
 19256 0000197A E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 19257                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19258                                  
 19259                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 19260                                  
 19261                                  intformat:
 19262 0000197D 06                      		push	es
 19263 0000197E 53                      		push	bx
 19264 0000197F 56                      		push	si
 19265 00001980 57                      		push	di
 19266 00001981 1E                      		push	ds
 19267                                  
 19268                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 19269                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 19270                                  
 19271 00001982 06                      		push	es
 19272 00001983 1E                      		push	ds
 19273 00001984 07                      		pop	es
 19274 00001985 1F                      		pop	ds
 19275 00001986 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 19276 00001988 BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector
 19277 0000198B E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 19278 0000198E 1F                      		pop	ds
 19279 0000198F 5F                      		pop	di
 19280 00001990 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 19281 00001991 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 19282                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19283                                  
 19284                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 19285                                  ; the first block.
 19286                                  ;
 19287                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 19288                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 19289                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 19290                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 19291                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 19292                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 19293                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 19294                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 19295                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 19296                                  
 19297                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 19298                                  doblock:
 19299                                  
 19300                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 19301                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 19302                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 19303                                  				
 19304 00001993 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 19305                                  					; get head #, drive #
 19306 00001996 51                      		push	cx
 19307 00001997 06                      		push	es
 19308 00001998 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 19309                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 19310 00001999 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 19311 0000199C 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 19312                                  		; 26/12/2023
 19313 000019A0 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 19314                                  		; 12/12/2022
 19315                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 19316                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 19317 000019A5 5F                      		pop	di
 19318 000019A6 07                      		pop	es
 19319 000019A7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 19320 000019A9 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 19321 000019AB B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 19322 000019AD 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 19323                                  doblockflop:
 19324 000019AF 59                      		pop	cx
 19325                                  doblockcontinue:
 19326 000019B0 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 19327 000019B2 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 19328 000019B4 50                      		push	ax
 19329 000019B5 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 19330 000019B7 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 19331                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19332                                  
 19333                                  doblocklast:
 19334 000019B9 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 19335 000019BB 50                      		push	ax
 19336                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 19337 000019BC E82CFE                  		call	doint
 19338 000019BF 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 19339 000019C1 58                      		pop	ax
 19340 000019C2 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 19341                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 19342 000019C5 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 19343 000019C7 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 19344 000019C9 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 19345 000019CB 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 19346 000019CD 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 19347                                  					; then we are done already.
 19348 000019CF 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 19349                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 19350 000019D1 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 19351 000019D4 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 19352                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19353                                  
 19354                                  bufferx:
 19355 000019D6 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 19356                                  					; set up head number
 19357                                  buffer:
 19358 000019D9 53                      		push	bx
 19359 000019DA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 19360 000019DD 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 19361 000019E0 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 19362                                  					
 19363                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 19364                                  
 19365 000019E2 06                      		push	es
 19366 000019E3 1E                      		push	ds
 19367 000019E4 56                      		push	si
 19368 000019E5 57                      		push	di
 19369 000019E6 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 19370 000019E7 06                      		push	es
 19371 000019E8 1F                      		pop	ds
 19372 000019E9 07                      		pop	es
 19373 000019EA BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 19374 000019ED 57                      		push	di		; save it
 19375 000019EE 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 19376 000019F0 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 19377 000019F3 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 19378                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 19379 000019F4 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 19380 000019F5 5E                      		pop	si
 19381 000019F6 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 19382                                  
 19383                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 19384                                  
 19385 000019F7 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 19386                                  					; get drive number
 19387 000019F9 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 19388 000019FC E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 19389                                  					;
 19390                                  					; ah is	function
 19391                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 19392                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 19393                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 19394                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 19395                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 19396 000019FF E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 19397 00001A02 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 19398 00001A03 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 19399 00001A05 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 19400                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19401                                  
 19402                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 19403                                  
 19404                                  doread:
 19405 00001A07 06                      		push	es
 19406 00001A08 53                      		push	bx
 19407 00001A09 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 19408 00001A0A 07                      		pop	es
 19409 00001A0B BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 19410 00001A0E B001                    		mov	al, 1
 19411 00001A10 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 19412                                  					; get drive number
 19413 00001A13 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 19414                                  					; ah = function
 19415                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 19416                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 19417                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 19418 00001A16 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 19419 00001A19 5B                      		pop	bx
 19420 00001A1A 07                      		pop	es
 19421 00001A1B 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 19422 00001A1D 56                      		push	si
 19423 00001A1E 57                      		push	di
 19424 00001A1F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 19425 00001A21 BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 19426 00001A24 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 19427 00001A27 5F                      		pop	di
 19428 00001A28 5E                      		pop	si
 19429                                  
 19430                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 19431                                  
 19432                                  dotail:
 19433 00001A29 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 19434 00001A2A 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 19435 00001A2D 41                      		inc	cx
 19436 00001A2E 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 19437 00001A31 F8                      		clc
 19438 00001A32 FEC8                    		dec	al
 19439 00001A34 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 19440                                  
 19441                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 19442                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 19443                                  
 19444 00001A36 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 19445 00001A39 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 19446 00001A3C E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 19447                                  
 19448                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 19449                                  
 19450                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 19451                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 19452                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 19453                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 19454                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 19455                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 19456                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 19457                                  
 19458                                  bad13:
 19459 00001A3F 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 19460 00001A41 5D                      		pop	bp
 19461 00001A42 5B                      		pop	bx
 19462 00001A43 5B                      		pop	bx
 19463 00001A44 59                      		pop	cx
 19464 00001A45 5A                      		pop	dx
 19465 00001A46 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 19466 00001A48 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 19467                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19468                                  
 19469                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:	
 19470 00001A4B E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 19471                                  
 19472                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19473                                  		; 10/12/2022
 19474                                  		;db 	0
 19475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19476                                  
 19477                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 19478                                  
 19479                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19480                                  
 19481                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19482                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 19483                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19484                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19485                                  
 19486                                  		; 19/10/2022
 19487                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 19488 00001A4E 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 19489 00001A52 BF[3C05]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 19490 00001A55 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 19491 00001A56 07                      		pop	es
 19492 00001A57 E930EC                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 19493

 19497                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 19498                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 19499                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si

 19689                                  
 19690                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19691                                  ; at media check time, we need to really get down and check what the change is.
 19692                                  ; this is guaranteed to be expensive.
 19693                                  ;
 19694                                  ;	es:di -> bds, ds -> Bios_Data

 19699                                  mediacheck:

 19703 00001B2E 742F                    		jz	short mediaret

 19705                                  		;test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 40h ; [es:di+BDS.flags], fchanged ; 40h
 19706 00001B30 E85001                  		call	checkromchange

 19708 00001B35 50                      		push	ax
 19709 00001B36 52                      		push	dx
 19710 00001B37 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 19711                                  					; set logical drive number
 19712 00001B3B B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 19713 00001B3D CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 19714                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 19715                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status

 19717 00001B40 58                      		pop	ax
 19718 00001B41 721D                    		jb	short mediadovolid
 19719 00001B43 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; signal no change
 19720                                  
 19721                                  ; there are some drives with changeline that "lose" the changeline indication
 19722                                  ; if a different drive is accessed after the current one. in order to avoid
 19723                                  ; missing a media change, we return an "i don't know" to dos if the changeline
 19724                                  ; is not active and we are accessing a different drive from the last one.
 19725                                  ; if we are accessing the same drive, then we can safely rely on the changeline
 19726                                  ; status.
 19727                                  		; 19/10/2022
 19728 00001B46 8A1E[1E01]              		mov	bl, [tim_drv]	; get last drive accessed
 19729 00001B4A 26385D04                		cmp	[es:di+4], bl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 19730                                  					; (If the last drive accessed is not current drive
 19731                                  					; media	change status may be incorrect.	So,
 19732                                  					; "I don't now" will be returned even if it is indicated
 19733                                  					; as media is not changed.)
 19734 00001B4E 740F                    		jz	short mediaret	; (same	drive,
 19735                                  					; media	changeline indication is reliable)
 19736                                  
 19737                                  ; do the 2 second twiddle. if time >= 2 seconds, do a volid check.
 19738                                  ; otherwise return "i don't know" (strictly speaking, we should return a
 19739                                  ; "not changed" here since the 2 second test said no change.)
 19740                                  
 19741 00001B50 50                      		push	ax

 19743 00001B52 52                      		push	dx

 19752                                  mediaret:

 19754                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19755                                  
 19756                                  ; somehow the media was changed. look at vid to see. we do not look at fat
 19757                                  ; because this may be different since we only set medbyt when doing a read
 19758                                  ; or write.
 19759                                  
 19760                                  mediadovolid:
 19761 00001B60 E873EB                  		call	GetBp		; build	a new bpb in current bds

 19764 00001B68 73F5                    		jnb	short mediaret

 19766                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19767                                  
 19768                                  ; simple, quick check of latched change. if no indication, then return
 19769                                  ; otherwise do expensive check. if the expensive test fails, pop off the
 19770                                  ; return and set al = 15 (for invalid media change) which will be returned to
 19771                                  ; dos.
 19772                                  ;
 19773                                  ; for dos 3.3, this will work only for the drive that has changeline.
 19774                                  
 19775                                  ;	call with es:di -> bds, ds -> Bios_Data
 19776                                  ;	***** warning:  this routine will return one level up on the stack
 19777                                  ;			if an error occurs!
 19778                                  
 19779                                  checklatchio:
 19780                                  
 19781                                  ; if returning fake bpb then assume the disk has not changed
 19782                                  
 19783                                  		; 26/12/2023
 19784                                  		;cmp	word [es:di+3Ch], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.opcnt]	
 19785 00001B6D E8B0FF                  		call	chkopcnt

 19787

 19789

 19794 00001B75 7416                    		jz	short checkret
 19795

 19812 00001B8D C3                      		retn
 19813                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19814                                  
 19815                                  ; check the fat and the vid. return in di -1 or 0. return with carry set
 19816                                  ; only if there was a disk error. return that error code in ax.
 19817                                  ;
 19818                                  ;	called with es:di -> bds, ds -> Bios_Data

 19820                                  checkfatvid:

 19822 00001B91 09F6                    		or	si, si
 19823 00001B93 7835                    		js	short changed_drv
 19824                                  
 19825                                  ; the fat was the same. fall into check_vid and check volume id.
 19826                                  
 19827                                  		; fall into check_vid
 19828                                  
 19829                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 19830                                  
 19831                                  ; now with the extended boot record, the logic should be enhanced.
 19832                                  ;
 19833                                  ; if it is the extended boot record, then we check the volume serial
 19834                                  ; number instead of volume id. if it is different, then set si to -1.
 19835                                  ;
 19836                                  ; if it is same, then si= 1 (no change).
 19837                                  ;
 19838                                  ; if it is not the extended boot record, then just follows the old
 19839                                  ; logic. dos 4.00 will check if the # of fat in the boot record bpb
 19840                                  ; is not 0.  if it is 0 then it must be non_fat based system and
 19841                                  ; should have already covered by extended boot structure checking.
 19842                                  ; so, we will return "i don't know" by setting si to 0.
 19843                                  ;
 19844                                  ; this routine assume the newest valid boot record is in cs:[disksector].
 19845                                  ; (this will be gauranteed by a successful getbp call right before this
 19846                                  ; routine.)
 19847                                  ;
 19848                                  ;	called with es:di -> bds, ds -> bds
 19849                                  
 19850                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 19851                                  		; 19/10/2022
 19852                                  check_vid:
 19853                                  
 19854                                  ; check the disksector.EXT_BOOT_SIG variable for the extended
 19855                                  ; boot signature. if it is set then go to do the extended
 19856                                  ; id check otherwise continue with code below
 19857                                  
 19858                                  		; 26/12/2023
 19859                                  		;;;

 19887                                  vid_no_changed:

 19889                                  		; 12/12/2022
 19890                                  		; cf=0 ('and' instruction in 'resetchanged' clears cf) 
 19891                                  		;clc
 19892                                  checkfatret:

 19895                                  
 19896                                  		; 12/12/2022
 19897                                  changed_drv:

 19899 00001BCB C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte  [tim_drv], 0FFh 
 19900                                  					; ensure that we ask rom for media
 19901 00001BD0 C3                      		retn			; check	next time round
 19902                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19903                                  
 19904                                  ; extended id check
 19905                                  
 19906                                  ; 16/10/2022
 19907                                  
 19908                                  ; the code to check extended id is basically a check to see if the
 19909                                  ; volume serial number is still the same. the volume serial number
 19910                                  ; previously read is in cs:disksector.EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 19911                                  ; ds:di points to the bds of the drive under consideration.
 19912                                  ; the bds has fields containing the high and low words 
 19913                                  ; of the volume serial number of the media in the drive.
 19914                                  ; compare these fields to the fields mentioned above. if these fields
 19915                                  ; do not match the media has changed and so we should jump to the code
 19916                                  ; starting at ext_changed else return "i don't know" status
 19917                                  ; in the register used for the changeline status and continue executing
 19918                                  ; the code given below. for temporary storage use the register which
 19919                                  ; has been saved and restored around this block.
 19920                                  ;
 19921                                  ; bds fields in inc\msbds.inc
 19922                                  
 19923                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 19924                                  		; 19/10/2022
 19925                                  do_ext_check_id:
 19926                                  		; 26/12/2023
 19927                                  		;push	ax
 19928                                  		;;mov	ax, word ptr ds:disksector+27h
 19929                                  		;			; [DiskSector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 19930                                  		;mov	ax, [disksector+27h]
 19931                                  ; 26/12/2023
 19932                                  %if 1
 19933                                  		;;;
 19934 00001BD1 57                      		push	di
 19935 00001BD2 BE[9501]                		mov	si, disksector+43h ; BS_FAT32_VolID
 19936                                  					; [DiskSector+FAT32_EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 19937 00001BD5 833E[6801]00            		cmp	word [disksector+16h], 0 ; BPB_FATSz16
 19938 00001BDA 7403                    		jz	short chk_vid_3
 19939 00001BDC 83EE1C                  		sub	si, 28		; BS_VolID
 19940                                  		; si = disksector+27h	; [DiskSector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 19941                                  chk_vid_3:
 19942                                  		; [es:di+89h] = [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 19943 00001BDF 81C78900                		add	di, 137		; BDS.vol_serial
 19944 00001BE3 A7                      		cmpsw	; [DiskSector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL] ; (or FAT32_EXT_BOOT)
 19945                                  			;		= [di+BDS.vol_serial] ?
 19946 00001BE4 7501                    		jnz	short chk_vid_4
 19947 00001BE6 A7                      		cmpsw	; [DiskSector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2] ; (or FAT32_EXT_BOOT)
 19948                                  			;		= [di+BDS.vol_serial+2] ?
 19949                                  chk_vid_4:
 19950 00001BE7 5F                      		pop	di
 19951                                  		;pop	ax
 19952 00001BE8 7504                    		jnz	short ext_changed ; not equal/same
 19953 00001BEA 31F6                    		xor	si, si 		 ; 0 ; don't know
 19954 00001BEC EBD8                    		jmp	short vid_no_changed ; reset the flag
 19955                                  		;;;
 19956                                  %else
 19957                                  		; 02/09/2023
 19958                                  		xor	si, si ; 0
