 19960                                  		jnz	short ext_changed
 19961                                  		mov	ax, [disksector+29h] ; [DiskSector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 19962                                  		cmp	ax, [es:di+59h]	; [di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 19963                                  		jnz	short ext_changed
 19964                                  		;xor	si, si		; 0
 19965                                  					; don't know
 19966                                  		pop	ax
 19967                                  		jmp	short vid_no_changed
 19968                                  					; reset the flag
 19969                                  %endif

 19985                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 19986                                  
 19987                                  ; at i/o time, we detected the error. now we need to determine whether the
 19988                                  ; media was truly changed or not. we return normally if media change unknown.
 19989                                  ; and we pop off the call and jmp to harderr if we see an error.
 19990                                  ;
 19991                                  ; es:di -> bds
 19992                                  
 19993                                  checkio:				
 19994 00001BF3 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6
 19995 00001BF6 75D1                    		jnz	short checkfatret
 19996 00001BF8 E825FF                  		call	chkopcnt
 19997 00001BFB 74CC                    		jz	short checkfatret
 19998 00001BFD E8D6EA                  		call	GetBp
 19999 00001C00 7212                    		jb	short no_error_map
 20000 00001C02 E889FF                  		call	checkfatvid
 20001 00001C05 7209                    		jb	short checkioret ; disk	error trying to	read in.
 20002 00001C07 09F6                    		or	si, si		; is changed for sure?
 20003 00001C09 7802                    		js	short checkioerr ; yes changed
 20004 00001C0B 45                      		inc	bp		; allow	a retry
 20005 00001C0C C3                      		retn

 20013 00001C11 E950F1                  		jmp	harderr

 20015

 20017 00001C14 E950F1                  		jmp	harderr2

 20065                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20066                                  ;   hidensity - examine a drive/media descriptor to set the media type. if
 20067                                  ;   the media descriptor is not f9 (not 96tpi or 3 1/2), we return and let the
 20068                                  ;   caller do the rest. otherwise, we pop off the return and jump to the tail
 20069                                  ;   of getbp. for 3.5" media, we just return.
 20070                                  ;
 20071                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds for this drive
 20072                                  ;		ah has media byte
 20073                                  ;
 20074                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 20075                                  ;		    no registers modified
 20076                                  ;		carry set
 20077                                  ;		    al = sectors/fat
 20078                                  ;		    bh = number of root directory entries
 20079                                  ;		    bl = sectors per track
 20080                                  ;		    cx = number of sectors
 20081                                  ;		    dh = sectors per allocation unit
 20082                                  ;		    dl = number of heads
 20083                                  ;
 20084                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20085                                  
 20086                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0

 20088                                  
 20089                                  ; check for correct drive
 20090                                  		
 20091                                  		; 26/12/2023
 20092 00001C36 26F6453F02              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 2 ; is it special?
 20093                                  		; 12/12/2022
 20094                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 2
 20095                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 2 ; is it special?
 20096                                  					; [es:di+BDS.flags], fchangeline
 20097 00001C3B 74F8                    		jz	short dofloppy	; no, do normal floppy test
 20098                                  
 20099                                  ; we have a media byte that is pretty complex. examine drive information
 20100                                  ; table to see what kind it is.
 20101

 20104                                  		;cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; is it single-media?
 20105 00001C42 74F1                    		jz	short dofloppy	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor], ffSmall
 20106                                  					; yes, use fatid...
 20107                                  ; 96 tpi drive?
 20108 00001C44 80FCF9                  		cmp	ah, 0F9h
 20109 00001C47 75EC                    		jnz	short dofloppy

 20111                                  ;------ If formfactor of drive = ffother or ff288 it has to be
 20112                                  ;------ a 720K diskette

 20114                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)

 20116 00001C49 268A453E                		mov	al, [es:di+3Eh] ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 20117                                  		;mov	al, [es:di+22h]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 20118 00001C4D 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7

 20124                                  					; ff288

 20132                                  					; 2 sides

 20135 00001C5E BA0201                  		mov	dx, 258		; 1*256+2
 20136                                  					; sectors/allocation unit
 20137                                  					; & head max
 20138                                  		;add	sp, 2		; pop off return address
 20139 00001C61 E9E6EA                  		jmp	Has1		; return to tail of getbp

 20157                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20158                                  ; set_changed_dl - sets flag bits according to bits set in bx.
 20159                                  ;		   essentially used to indicate changeline, or format.
 20160                                  ;
 20161                                  ;   inputs:	dl contains physical drive number
 20162                                  ;		bx contains bits to set in the flag field in the bdss
 20163                                  ;   outputs:	none
 20164                                  ;   registers modified: flags
 20165                                  ;
 20166                                  ;	called from int13 hooker.  Must preserve ALL registers!!!
 20167                                  ;
 20168                                  ; in the virtual drive system we *must* flag the other drives as being changed
 20169                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20170                                  
 20171                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20172                                  set_changed_dl:	
 20173 00001C68 06                      		push	es
 20174 00001C69 57                      		push	di
 20175                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds
 20176                                  		; 19/10/2022

 20179                                  ; note: we assume that the list is non-empty
 20180                                  
 20181                                  scan_bds:
 20182 00001C6E 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 20183 00001C72 7504                    		jnz	short get_next_bds
 20184                                  
 20185                                  ; someone may complain, but this *always* must be done when a disk change is
 20186                                  ; noted. there are *no* other compromising circumstances.
 20187                                  
 20188                                  		; 26/12/2023
 20189 00001C74 26095D3F                		or	[es:di+3Fh], bx	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 20190                                  		;or	[es:di+23h], bx	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 20191                                  					; signal change	on other drive
 20192                                  get_next_bds:

 20194                                  					; go to	next bds

 20270                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20271                                  ; set_volume_id      -	main routine, calls other routines.
 20272                                  ; read_volume_id     -	read the volume id and tells if it has been changed.
 20273                                  ; transfer_volume_id -	copy the volume id from tmp to special drive.
 20274                                  ; check_volume_id    -	compare volume id in tmp area with one expected for drive.
 20275                                  ; fat_check          -	see of the fatid has changed in the specified drive.
 20276                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20277                                  
 20278                                  ; set_volume_id
 20279                                  ;   if drive has changeline support, read in and set the volume_id
 20280                                  ; and the last fat_id byte. if no change line support then do nothing.
 20281                                  ;
 20282                                  ;   on entry:
 20283                                  ;	es:di points to the bds for this disk.
 20284                                  ;	ah contains media byte
 20285                                  ;
 20286                                  ;   on exit:
 20287                                  ;	carry clear:
 20288                                  ;	   successful call
 20289                                  ;	carry set
 20290                                  ;	   error and ax has error code
 20291                                  
 20292                                  set_volume_id:
 20293 00001C95 52                      		push	dx		; save registers
 20294 00001C96 50                      		push	ax
 20295 00001C97 E8F5FF                  		call	haschange	; does drive have changeline support?
 20296 00001C9A 740B                    		jz	short setvret	; no, get out
 20297 00001C9C E81000                  		call	read_volume_id
 20298 00001C9F 7209                    		jb	short seterr
 20299 00001CA1 E8A900                  		call	transfer_volume_id ; copy the volume id	to special drive
 20300 00001CA4 E8E2FF                  		call	resetchanged	; restore value	of change line
 20301                                  setvret:				
 20302                                  		; 10/12/2022
 20303                                  		; cf = 0
 20304                                  		;clc			; no error, clear carry flag
 20305 00001CA7 58                      		pop	ax		; restore registers
 20306 00001CA8 5A                      		pop	dx
 20307 00001CA9 C3                      		retn
 20308                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20309                                  
 20310                                  seterr:
 20311 00001CAA 5A                      		pop	dx		; pop stack but don't overwrite ax
 20312 00001CAB 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore dx
 20313 00001CAC C3                      		retn

 20315 00001CAD 0000                    root_sec:	dw 0			; root sector #

 20325                                  
 20326                                  ; read_volume_id read the volume id and tells if it has been changed.
 20327                                  ;
 20328                                  ;   on entry:
 20329                                  ;	es:di points to current bds for drive.
 20330                                  ;
 20331                                  ;   on exit:
 20332                                  ;	carry clear
 20333                                  ;	    si = 1  no change
 20334                                  ;	    si = 0  ?
 20335                                  ;	    si = -1 change
 20336                                  ;
 20337                                  ;	carry set:
 20338                                  ;	    error and ax has error code.
 20339                                  
 20340                                  read_volume_id:
 20341 00001CAF 52                      		push	dx		; preserve registers
 20342 00001CB0 51                      		push	cx
 20343 00001CB1 53                      		push	bx
 20344 00001CB2 50                      		push	ax

 20346 00001CB4 57                      		push	di
 20347 00001CB5 1E                      		push	ds		; point es to Bios_Data
 20348 00001CB6 07                      		pop	es
 20349 00001CB7 BF[4008]                		mov	di, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 20350 00001CBA BE[6305]                		mov	si, nul_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 20351                                  		; 26/12/2023
 20352 00001CBD B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; PCDOS 7.1 - 02/09/2023
 20353                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; initialize tmp_vid to	null vi_id
 20354                                  		
 20355                                  		;rep	movsb
 20356                                  		; 26/12/2023
 20357                                  		;rep movs byte ptr es:[di], byte ptr cs:[si]
 20358                                  		;db 0FBh,2Eh,0A4h 
 20359                                  		;cs	; nul_vid is in BIOSCODE segment 
 20360                                  		;rep movsb
 20361 00001CC0 F3                      		rep
 20362 00001CC1 2E                      		cs
 20363 00001CC2 A4                      		movsb	
 20364                                  		
 20365 00001CC3 5F                      		pop	di
 20366 00001CC4 07                      		pop	es
 20367 00001CC5 268A450B                		mov	al, [es:di+11]	; [es:di+BDS.fats]
 20368                                  					; # of fats

 20370                                  					; sectors / fat

 20376                                  		; 17/10/2022

 20379                                  					; 0070h:3EFFh =	2C7h:198Fh

 20381                                  					; # root dir entries

 20383 00001CDD D3E8                    		shr	ax, cl		; divide by 16
 20384                                  		;mov	cx, ax		; cx is	# of sectors to	scan

 20386 00001CDF 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; cx is	# of sectors to	scan
 20387                                  next_sec:

 20389 00001CE1 2EA1[AD1C]              		mov	ax, [cs:ROOTSEC]

 20391                                  					; get sector #

 20393                                  					; sectors / track

 20396                                  
 20397                                  ; set up registers for call to read_sector
 20398                                  
 20399 00001CED 42                      		inc	dx		; dx= sectors into track
 20400                                  					; ax= track count from 0
 20401 00001CEE 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; sector to read
 20402 00001CF0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 20403 00001CF2 26F77515                		div	word [es:di+21] ; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 20404                                  					; # heads on this disc
 20405 00001CF6 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; head number
 20406 00001CF8 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; track	#
 20407 00001CFA E8B9EB                  		call	read_sector	; get first sector of the root directory,
 20408                                  					; ds:bx	-> directory sector
 20409 00001CFD 723F                    		jb	short readviderr
 20410 00001CFF B91000                  		mov	cx, 16		; # of dir entries in a	block of root
 20411 00001D02 B008                    		mov	al, 8		; volume label bit
 20412                                  fvid_loop:
 20413                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 20414 00001D04 382F                    		cmp	[bx], ch ; 0				
 20415                                  		;cmp	byte [bx], 0 ; end of dir?
 20416 00001D06 7433                    		jz	short no_vid	; yes, no vol id
 20417 00001D08 803FE5                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E5h ; empty entry?
 20418 00001D0B 7405                    		jz	short ent_loop	; yes, skip
 20419 00001D0D 84470B                  		test	[bx+11], al	; is volume label bit set in fcb?
 20420 00001D10 750F                    		jnz	short found_vid	; jmp yes
 20421                                  ent_loop:
 20422 00001D12 83C320                  		add	bx, 32		; add length of	directory entry
 20423 00001D15 E2ED                    		loop	fvid_loop
 20424 00001D17 59                      		pop	cx		; outer loop
 20425 00001D18 2EFF06[AD1C]            		inc	word [cs:ROOTSEC]
 20426                                  		;inc	word ptr cs:198Fh ; inc word [root_sec]
 20427                                  					; next sector
 20428 00001D1D E2C1                    		loop	next_sec	; continue
 20429                                  notfound:
 20430                                  		; 02/09/2023
 20431                                  		;xor	si, si
 20432 00001D1F EB13                    		jmp	short fvid_ret
 20433                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20434                                  
 20435                                  found_vid:
 20436                                  		; 02/09/2023
 20437                                  		; cf = 0  ('test' instruction clears cf)
 20438 00001D21 59                      		pop	cx		; clean stack of outer loop counter
 20439 00001D22 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; point	to volume_id
 20440 00001D24 06                      		push	es		; preserve current bds
 20441 00001D25 57                      		push	di
 20442 00001D26 1E                      		push	ds
 20443 00001D27 07                      		pop	es		; point es to Bios_Data
 20444 00001D28 BF[4008]                		mov	di, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 20445 00001D2B B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; VOLID_SIZ-1
 20446                                  					; length of string minus nul
 20447 00001D2E F3A4                    		rep movsb		; mov volume label to tmp_vid
 20448                                  		;xor	al, al
 20449                                  		; 02/09/2023
 20450 00001D30 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; ax = 0
 20451 00001D31 AA                      		stosb			; null terminate
 20452                                  		;;xor	si, si
 20453                                  		; 02/09/2023
 20454                                  		;xchg	ax, si		; si = 0
 20455 00001D32 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 20456 00001D33 07                      		pop	es
 20457                                  fvid_ret:
 20458                                  		; 02/09/2023
 20459 00001D34 31F6                    		xor	si, si ; 0
 20460                                  				
 20461 00001D36 58                      		pop	ax
 20462                                  		; 10/12/2022
 20463                                  		; cf = 0
 20464                                  		;clc
 20465                                  rvidret:
 20466 00001D37 5B                      		pop	bx		; restore registers
 20467 00001D38 59                      		pop	cx
 20468 00001D39 5A                      		pop	dx
 20469 00001D3A C3                      		retn
 20470                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20471                                  
 20472                                  no_vid:
 20473 00001D3B 59                      		pop	cx		; clean stack of outer loop counter
 20474                                  		;jmp	short notfound	; not found
 20475                                  		; 02/09/2023
 20476 00001D3C EBF6                    		jmp	short fvid_ret
 20477                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20478                                  
 20479                                  readviderr:
 20480 00001D3E 5E                      		pop	si		; trash the outer loop counter
 20481 00001D3F 5E                      		pop	si		; caller's ax, return error code instead
 20482 00001D40 EBF5                    		jmp	short rvidret
 20483                                  
 20484                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20485                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20486                                  		; 02/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (IO.SYS optimization)
 20487                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1DCFh 
 20488                                  preset_volid_addr:
 20489 00001D42 BE[4008]                		mov	si, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME    "
 20490                                  		; 26/12/2023
 20491                                  		; PCDOS 7.1
 20492 00001D45 83C77D                  		add	di, 125		; BDS.volid
 20493 00001D48 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; VOLID_SIZ (12 for MSDOS 5.0-6.22 versions)
 20494                                  		; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS 5.0 & 6.?)
 20495                                  		;add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 20496                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; VOLID_SIZ
 20497                                  		;
 20498 00001D4B FC                      		cld
 20499 00001D4C C3                      		retn
 20500                                  
 20501                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 20502                                  
 20503                                  ; transfer_volume_id - copy the volume id from tmp to special drive
 20504                                  ;
 20505                                  ; inputs:	es:di has current bds
 20506                                  ; outputs:	bds for drive has volume id from tmp
 20507                                  
 20508                                  		; 27/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20509                                  transfer_volume_id:
 20510 00001D4D 57                      		push	di		; copy the volume id from tmp to special drive
 20511                                  		;push	si
 20512 00001D4E 51                      		push	cx
 20513                                  		; 27/12/2023
 20514 00001D4F 56                      		push	si
 20515                                  
 20516                                  		;mov	si, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 20517                                  		;;add	di, BDS.volid
 20518                                  		;add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 20519                                  		;;mov	cx, VOLID_SIZ
 20520                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; VOLID_SIZ
 20521                                  		;cld
 20522                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 20523 00001D50 E8EFFF                  		call	preset_volid_addr
 20524                                  
 20525 00001D53 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 20526                                  		
 20527                                  		; 27/12/2023
 20528 00001D55 5E                      		pop	si
 20529                                  chk_volid_ok:
 20530 00001D56 59                      		pop	cx
 20531                                  		;pop	si
 20532 00001D57 5F                      		pop	di
 20533 00001D58 C3                      		retn
 20534                                  
 20535                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 20536                                  
 20537                                  ;  check_volume_id - compare volume id in tmp area with
 20538                                  ;		     one expected for drive
 20539                                  ;
 20540                                  ;   inputs:	es:di has current bds for drive
 20541                                  ;   outputs:	zero true means it matched
 20542                                  
 20543                                  		; 27/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20544                                  check_volume_id:
 20545 00001D59 57                      		push	di
 20546 00001D5A 51                      		push	cx
 20547                                  		
 20548                                  		;mov	si, tmp_vid	; "NO NAME	 "
 20549                                  		;;add	di, BDS.volid
 20550                                  		;add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 20551                                  		;;mov	cx, VOLID_SIZ
 20552                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; VOLID_SIZ
 20553                                  		;cld
 20554                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 20555 00001D5B E8E4FF                  		call	preset_volid_addr
 20556                                  
 20557 00001D5E F3A6                    		repe cmpsb		; are the 2 volume_ids the same?
 20558                                  		
 20559                                  		; 27/12/2023
 20560                                  		;pop	cx
 20561                                  		;pop	di
 20562                                  		;retn
 20563 00001D60 EBF4                    		jmp	short chk_volid_ok
 20564                                  
 20565                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 20566                                  
 20567                                  ;   fat_check - see of the fatid has changed in the specified drive.
 20568                                  ;	      - uses the fat id obtained from the boot sector.
 20569                                  ;
 20570                                  ;   inputs:	medbyt is expected fat id
 20571                                  ;		es:di points to current bds
 20572                                  ;
 20573                                  ;   output:	si = -1 if fat id different,
 20574                                  ;		si = 0 otherwise
 20575                                  ;
 20576                                  ;   no other registers changed.
 20577                                  
 20578                                  fat_check:
 20579 00001D62 50                      		push	ax
 20580 00001D63 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; say fat id's are same.
 20581 00001D65 A0[1F01]                		mov	al, [medbyt]	; 19/10/2022
 20582 00001D68 263A4510                		cmp	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 20583                                  					; compare it with the bds medbyte
 20584 00001D6C 7401                    		jz	short okret1	; carry	clear
 20585 00001D6E 4E                      		dec	si
 20586                                  okret1:
 20587 00001D6F 58                      		pop	ax
 20588 00001D70 C3                      		retn
 20589

 20591

 20593                                  		;times 2 db 0
 20594                                  
 20595                                  ; BIOSCODE:1A69h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) ((& MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS))
 20596                                  		;times 7 db 0
 20597                                  
 20598                                  ; BIOSCODE:180Bh (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)	
 20599                                  
 20600                                  		; 09/12/2022
 20601                                  		;times 4 db 0	; 17/10/2022
 20602                                  		;db 4 dup(0)	; times 4 db 0
 20603

 20605                                  
 20606                                  		; 09/12/2022
 20607                                  		;db 0
 20608                                  
 20609                                  number2div	equ ($-BCode_start)
 20610                                  number2mod	equ (number2div % 16)
 20611                                  
 20612                                  %if number2mod>0 & number2mod<16
 20613 00001D71 00<rep Fh>              		times (16-number2mod) db 0
 20614                                  %endif
 20615                                  
 20616                                  ;align 16
 20617                                  
 20618                                  ; 09/12/2022
 20619                                  BCODE_END	equ $ - BCode_start
 20620                                  ;SYSINITSEG	equ IOSYSCODESEG+(BCODE_END>>4)
 20621                                  ; 13/12/2022

 20649                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 20650                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 20651                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20652                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 20653                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20654                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 20655                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20656                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 20657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20658                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 20659                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20660                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 20661                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20662                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 20663                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 20664                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20665                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 20666                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 20667                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 20668                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 20669                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 20670                                  
 20671                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 20672                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 20673                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 20674                                   
 20675                                  ; 21/10/2022
 20676                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20677                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 20678                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 20679                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 20680                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20681                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 20682                                  
 20683                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 20684                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 20685                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 20686                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 20687                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 20688                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 20689                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 20690                                  ;
 20691                                  ;
 20692                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 20693                                  ;
 20694                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 20695                                  ;
 20696                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 20697                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 20698                                  ;
 20699                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 20700                                  ;
 20701                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 20702                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 20703                                  ;
 20704                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 20705                                  ;
 20706                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 20707                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 20708                                  ;value.
 20709                                  ;
 20710                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 20711                                  ;
 20712                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 20713                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 20714                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 20715                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 20716                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 20717                                  ;
 20718                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 20719                                  ;
 20720                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 20721                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 20722                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 20723                                  ;
 20724                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 20725                                  ;
 20726                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 20727                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 20728                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 20729                                  ;
 20730                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 20731                                  ;
 20732                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 20733                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 20734                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 20735                                  ;
 20736                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 20737                                  ;
 20738                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 20739                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 20740                                  ;
 20741                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 20742                                  ;
 20743                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 20744                                  ;
 20745                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 20746                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 20747                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 20748                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 20749                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 20750                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 20751                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 20752                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 20753                                  ;memory.
 20754                                  ;NOTES:
 20755                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 20756                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 20757                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 20758                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 20759                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 20760                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 20761                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 20762                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 20763                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 20764                                  
 20765                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20766                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 20767                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20768                                  
 20769                                  ;include version.inc
 20770                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20771                                  
 20772                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 20773                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 20774                                  
 20775                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 20776                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 20777                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 20778                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 20779                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 20780                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 20781                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 20782                                  
 20783                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 20784                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20785                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 20786                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 20787                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20788                                  
 20789                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 20790                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20791                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 20792                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 20793                                  
 20794                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 20795                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 20796                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 20797                                  
 20798                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 20799                                  
 20800                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 20801                                  				; currently 0.
 20802                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 20803                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 20804                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 20805                                  
 20806                                  ;      if1
 20807                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 20808                                  ;      endif
 20809                                  
 20810                                         ;******************************
 20811                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 20812                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 20813                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 20814                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 20815                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 20816                                         ;******************************
 20817                                  
 20818                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20819                                  ; device definitions
 20820                                  
 20821                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 20822                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 20823                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 20824                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 20825                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 20826                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 20827                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 20828                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 20829                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 20830                                  
 20831                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 20832                                  struc	SYSDEV
 20833 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 20834 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 20835 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 20836 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 20837 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 20838                                  .size:
 20839                                  endstruc
 20840                                  
 20841                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 20842                                  struc	SRHEAD
 20843 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 20844 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 20845 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 20846 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 20847 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 20848                                  .size:
 20849                                  endstruc
 20850                                  
 20851                                  ;Status word masks
 20852                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 20853                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 20854                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 20855                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 20856                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 20857                                  
 20858                                  ;Function codes
 20859                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 20860                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 20861                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 20862                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 20863                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 20864                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 20865                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 20866                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 20867                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 20868                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 20869                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 20870                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 20871                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 20872                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 20873                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 20874                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 20875                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 20876                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 20877                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 20878                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 20879                                  
 20880                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20881                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 20882 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 20883 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 20884 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 20885 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 20886 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 20887 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 20888                                                          ; word
 20889 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 20890 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 20891 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 20892 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 20893                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 20894                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 20895                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 20896                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 20897                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 20898                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 20899                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 20900                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 20901 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 20902 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 20903 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 20904 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 20905 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 20906 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 20907                                  .size:
 20908                                  endstruc
 20909                                  
 20910                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20911                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 20912                                  
 20913                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 20914                                  
 20915                                  struc buffinfo
 20916 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 20917 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 20918 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 20919                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 20920                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 20921 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 20922                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 20923                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 20924                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 20925                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 20926                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 20927                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 20928                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 20929                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 20930 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 20931                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 20932 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 20933 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 20934 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 20935 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 20936 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 20937                                  .size:
 20938                                  endstruc
 20939                                  
 20940                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 20941                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 20942                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 20943                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 20944                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 20945                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 20946                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 20947                                  
 20948                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 20949                                  
 20950                                  
 20951                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 20952                                  
 20953                                  ;Flag byte masks
 20954                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 20955                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 20956                                  ;***
 20957                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 20958                                  ;***
 20959                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 20960                                  
 20961                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 20962                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 20963                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 20964                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 20965                                  
 20966                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 20969                                  
 20970                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20971                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 20972                                  
 20973                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 20974                                  
 20975                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 20976                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 20977                                  ;
 20978                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 20979                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 20980                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 20981                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 20982                                  ;
 20983                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 20984                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 20985                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 20986                                  
 20987                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 20988                                  
 20989                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20990                                  
 20991                                  struc	DPB
 20992 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 20993 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 20994 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 20995 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 20996 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 20997 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 20998 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 20999 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 21000 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 21001 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 21002                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 21003 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 21004 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 21005 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 21006 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 21007 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 21008                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 21009 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 21010 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 21011 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 21012                                  .size:
 21013                                  endstruc
 21014                                  
 21015                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 21016                                  
 21017                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 21074                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 21075                                  
 21076                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 21077                                  ;
 21078                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 21079                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 21080                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 21081                                  ;
 21082                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 21083                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 21084                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 21085                                  ;
 21086                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 21087                                  
 21088                                  struc A_BPB
 21089 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 21090 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 21091 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 21092 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 21093 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 21094 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 21095 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 21096 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 21097 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 21098 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 21099 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 21100 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 21101 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 21102 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 21103 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 21104                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 21105                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 21106                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 21107                                  .size:
 21108                                  endstruc
 21109                                  
 21110                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 21111 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 21112 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1

 21114 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 21115 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1

 21118 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size

 21367                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21368                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 21369                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21370                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 21371                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 21372                                  									  
 21373                                  ;*******************************					  
 21374                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 21375                                  ;*******************************					  
 21376                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 21377                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 21378                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 21379                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 21380                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 21381                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 21382                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 21383                                  ;For all others:							  
 21384                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 21385                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 21386                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 21387                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 21388                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 21389                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 21390                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 21391                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 21392                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 21393                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 21394                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 21395                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 21396                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 21397                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 21398                                  ;									  
 21399                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 21400                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 21401                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 21402                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 21403                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 21404                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 21405                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 21406                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 21407                                  ;									  
 21408                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 21409                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 21410                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 21411                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 21412                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 21413                                  ;									  
 21414                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 21415                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 21416                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 21417                                  ;									  
 21418                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 21419                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 21420                                  ;									  
 21421                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 21422                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 21423                                  ;									  
 21424                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 21425                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 21426                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 21427                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 21428                                  ;						called. 		  
 21429                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 21430                                  ;									  
 21431                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 21432                                  ;									  
 21433                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 21434                                  ;									  
 21435                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 21436                                  ;									  
 21437                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 21438                                  ;									  
 21439                                  
 21440                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 21441                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 21442 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 21443 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 21444                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 21445 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 21446 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 21447 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 21448 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 21449                                  endstruc					  
 21450

 21454                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b

 21456                                  					;;End of Modification

 21558                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21559                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 21560                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21561                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21562                                  
 21563                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 21564                                  ;
 21565                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 21566                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 21567                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 21568                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 21569                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 21570                                  ;
 21571                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 21572                                  ;
 21573                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 21574                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 21575                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 21576                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 21577                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 21578                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 21579                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 21580                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 21581                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 21582                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 21583                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 21584                                  
 21585                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 21586                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 21587                                  
 21588                                  struc 		curdir_list
 21589                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 21590 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 21591 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 21592 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 21593 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 21594 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 21595 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 21596                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 21597 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 21598 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 21599 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 21600                                  .size:
 21601                                  endstruc
 21602                                  
 21603                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 21604                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 21605                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 21606                                  						; argument
 21607                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 21608

 21610

 21618                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21619                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 21620                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21621                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21622                                  
 21623                                  ; system file table
 21624                                  
 21625                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 21626                                  ;
 21627                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 21628                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 21629                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 21630                                  
 21631                                  struc	SF
 21632 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 21633 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 21634 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 21635                                  .size:
 21636                                  endstruc
 21637                                  
 21638                                  ;**	System file table entry
 21639                                  ;
 21640                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 21641                                  
 21642                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 21643 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 21644                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 21645 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 21646 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 21647 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 21648                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 21649                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 21650                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 21651                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 21652                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 21653                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 21654                                  					;   (WRITE)
 21655                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 21656                                  					;
 21657                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 21658                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 21659                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 21660                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 21661                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 21662                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 21663                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 21664                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 21665                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 21666                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 21667                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 21668                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 21669 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 21670                                  					; to device header if local device,
 21671                                  					; points to net device header if
 21672                                  					; remote
 21673 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 21674                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 21675 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 21676 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 21677 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 21678 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 21679                                  ;
 21680                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 21681                                  ; ID
 21682                                  ;
 21683 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 21684 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 21685 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 21686                                  ;
 21687                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 21688                                  ;
 21689 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 21690                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 21691                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 21692                                  					; disk changed errors.
 21693                                  ; SHARING INFO
 21694 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 21695 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 21696 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 21697 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 21698 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 21699 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 21700                                  .size:
 21701                                  endstruc

 21972                                  SYSINIT$:
 21973                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 21974                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 21975                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message
 21976                                  	;   public Endstackcode
