 21979                                  
 21980                                  ; 05/07/2018
 21981                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21982                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21983                                  
 21984                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21985                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 21986                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21987                                  
 21988                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 21989                                  ;
 21990                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 21991                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 21992                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 21993                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 21994                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 21995                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 21996                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 21997                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 21998                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 21999                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 22000                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 22001                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 22002                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 22003                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 22004                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 22005                                  ;
 22006                                  
 22007                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 22008                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 22009                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 22010                                  ;
 22011                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 22012                                  ;
 22013                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 22014                                  ;
 22015                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 22016                                  ;
 22017                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 22018                                  ;
 22019                                  
 22020                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 22021                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 22022                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 22023                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 22024                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 22025                                  ;      deeply nested one
 22026                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 22027                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interrupts on a PCjr.
 22028                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 22029                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 22030                                  
 22031                                  		;EVEN
 22032                                  ;align 2
 22033                                  		; 21/10/2022
 22034                                  
 22035 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 22036 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 22037 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 22038 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 22039 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 22040 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 22041                                  
 22042 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 22043 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 22044 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 22045                                  
 22046                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22047                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 22048                                  
 22049                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22050                                  
 22051 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 22052                                  
 22053                                  int02:
 22054                                  
 22055                                  ; *********************************************************************
 22056                                  ;
 22057                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 22058                                  ;
 22059                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 22060                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 22061                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 22062                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 22063                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 22064                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 22065                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 22066                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 22067                                  ;
 22068                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 22069                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 22070                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 22071                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 22072                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 22073                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 22074                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 22075                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 22076                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 22077                                  ;
 22078                                  ; *********************************************************************
 22079                                  
 22080 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 22081 00000017 06                      	push	es
 22082 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 22083 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 22084                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22085 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 22086 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 22087 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 22088                                  
 22089 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 22090                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 22091                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 22092                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 22093                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 22094 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 22095 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 22096                                  special02:
 22097 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 22098 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 22099                                  normal02:
 22100 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 22101 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 22102 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 22103

 22307 0000012C [1901]                  	dw	old76
 22308                                  intret_76:

 22316 00000135 4B42                    	dw	424Bh
 22317                                  firstflag77:

 22328                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22329                                  
 22330                                  ;********************************************************************
 22331                                  ;common routines
 22332                                  ;********************************************************************
 22333                                  
 22334                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 22335                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 22336                                  ; service routine
 22337                                  
 22338                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22339                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22340                                  
 22341                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 22342                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 22343                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 22344                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 22345                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 22346                                  
 22347                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22348                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 22349                                  
 22350                                  do_int_stacks:
 22351 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 22352 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 22353 00000149 06                      	push	es
 22354 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 22355 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 22356 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 22357                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22358                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 22359                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22360 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 22361 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 22362 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 22363                                  
 22364 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 22365                                  
 22366                                  found02:
 22367 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 22368 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 22369                                  
 22370 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 22371                                  
 22372 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 22373                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22374                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 22375                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22376                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 22377 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 22378 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 22379                                  
 22380                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 22381 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 22382 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 22383 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 22384 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 22385 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 22386 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 22387 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 22388 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 22389                                  
 22390                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 22391                                  	;push    bp
 22392                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 22393                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 22394                                  	;pop     bp
 22395                                  	;push    es
 22396                                  	;pop     ss
 22397                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 22398                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 22399                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22400                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 22401                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 22402                                  
 22403 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 22404                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22405 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 22406                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22407                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 22408                                  
 22409 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 22410                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22411 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 22412                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22413                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 22414 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 22415 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 22416                                  
 22417                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22418                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 22419                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22420 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 22421 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 22422                                  
 22423 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 22424 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 22425 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 22426 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 22427 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 22428                                  
 22429                                  notfree02:
 22430 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 22431 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 22432                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22433                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 22434                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22435 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 22436                                  
 22437                                  findnext02:
 22438 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 22439 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 22440                                  
 22441                                  foundbad02:
 22442 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 22443 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 22444 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 22445                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22446                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 22447                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22448 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 22449 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 22450                                  
 22451                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22452                                  
 22453                                  ; Common routines
 22454                                  
 22455                                  longpath:
 22456                                  	; 21/03/2019
 22457 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 22458                                  lploopp:
 22459                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22460                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 22461                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22462 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 22463 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 22464                                  
 22465 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 22466                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22467                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 22468                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22469 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 22470 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 22471 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 22472                                  
 22473 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 22474 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 22475                                  
 22476                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22477                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 22478                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22479 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 22480                                  inuse:
 22481 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 22482 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 22483 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 22484 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 22485                                  found:
 22486 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 22487                                  fatal:
 22488 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 22489 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 22490 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22491 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 22492 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 22493 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 22494                                  
 22495 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 22496 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 22497                                  
 22498                                  skip_nmis:
 22499 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 22500 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 22501 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 22502 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 22503                                  
 22504 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 22505 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 22506 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 22507                                  ;SR;
 22508                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 22509                                  ;
 22510 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 22511 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 22512                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 22513                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 22514                                  	; 21/10/2022

 22516 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22517                                  
 22518                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 22519 0000021E F606[1208]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 22520 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 22521 00000224 58                      	pop	ax
 22522 00000225 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 22523

 22526                                  	; 21/10/2022

 22529                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 22530                                  ;
 22531                                  fatal_loop:

 22533 0000022D 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'

 23991                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 23992                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 23993                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 23994                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 23995                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 23996                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 23997                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 23998                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 23999                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 24000                                  ;
 24001                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 24002                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 24003                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 24004                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 24005                                  ; been patched.

 24326 000007A9 BA[E445]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 24327                                  
 24328                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 24329                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 24330                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 24331                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 24332                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 24333                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 24334                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 24335                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 24336                                  
 24337                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 24338                                  
 24339 000007AC 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name

 24345 000007B8 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 24346

 24351                                  
 24352                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 24353                                  
 24354                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 24355                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 24356                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 24357                                  
 24358                                  	; 22/10/2022
 24359                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 24361 000007C6 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 24362                                  
 24363                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 24364                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 24365                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 24366                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 24367                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 24368                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 24369                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 24370                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 24371                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 24372                                  ;
 24373                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 24374                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 24375                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 24376                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 24377                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 24378                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 24379                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 24380

 24697                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 24698                                  ;
 24699                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 24700                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 24701                                  ;
 24702                                  ; Inputs : None
 24703                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 24704                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 24705                                  ;	   free memory.
 24706                                  ;
 24707                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 24708                                  ;
 24709                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24710                                  	
 24711                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2

 24719 00000919 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC

 24721                                  	; 11/12/2022

 24723                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 24724                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to

 24726 00000920 A3[6403]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to

 24742                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 24743                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.

 24745                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 24767                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.

 24795                                  ;
 24796                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 24797                                  ;
 24798                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 24799                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 24800                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 24801                                  ;
 24802                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 24803                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 24804                                  ; 
 24805                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24806                                  
 24807                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24808                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 24809                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 24810                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24811                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24812                                  	; ds = cs
 24813 00000999 E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 24814 0000099C 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 24815                                  
 24816                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 24817                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24818                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 24819                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24820                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24821                                  	; ds = cs
 24822 0000099E 8E06[7302]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 24823                                  ;else
 24824                                  ;	..
 24825                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 24826                                  
 24827                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24828                                  	; ds = cs
 24829 000009A2 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 24830                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 24831 000009A4 FF1E[7D02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 24832                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 24833 000009A8 C606[6C02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 24834 000009AD F8                      	clc
 24835                                  ttldhx:
 24836 000009AE C3                      	retn

 24840                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 24841                                  ;
 24842                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 24843                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 24844                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 24845                                  ;
 24846                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 24847                                  ;
 24848                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24849                                  
 24850                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24851                                  MovDOSHi:
 24852                                  	; 14/05/2019
 24853                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24854                                  	; ds = cs

 24859                                  
 24860                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 24861                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 24862                                  
 24863                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 24864                                  	; 24/03/2019
 24865                                  	
 24866                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24867 000009B9 E83200                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 24868                                  
 24869                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 24870                                  	
 24871                                  	; 14/05/2019
 24872                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24873                                  	;xor	di,di
 24874                                  	
 24875                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24876                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 24877                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24878                                  	; ds = cs

 24880 000009C0 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 24881                                  
 24882                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 24883                                  ;else
 24884                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 24885                                  ;
 24886                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0

 24888                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS

 25148

 25151                                  	; ds = cs
 25152                                  	;mov	[FINAL_DOS_LOCATION],bx

 25219                                  
 25220                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 25221                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 25222                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 25223                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 25224                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 25225                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 25226                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 25227                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 25228                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 25229                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 25230                                  ;	  stub will go.
 25231                                  ;
 25232                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 25233                                  
 25234                                  	; 23/10/2022
 25235                                  update_arena:
 25236 00000A41 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 25237 00000A42 57                      	push	di
 25238 00000A43 51                      	push	cx
 25239 00000A44 52                      	push	dx
 25240                                  	; 23/10/2022
 25241                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 25242                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25243                                  	; ds = cs 
 25244 00000A45 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 25245 00000A49 4F                      	dec	di
 25246 00000A4A 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 25247                                  						;  before sysvar
 25248 00000A4B 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 25249                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 25250 00000A4D 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 25251 00000A52 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 25252 00000A54 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 25253                                  
 25254                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 25255 00000A56 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 25256 00000A5B 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 25257 00000A5D 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 25258 00000A5F 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 25259 00000A61 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 25260                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 25261 00000A63 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 25262                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 25263 00000A67 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 25264 00000A6D 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 25265                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 25266 00000A6F 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 25267 00000A73 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 25268                                  	; 23/10/2022
 25269                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 25270 00000A75 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 25271 00000A78 5A                      	pop	dx
 25272 00000A79 59                      	pop	cx
 25273 00000A7A 5F                      	pop	di
 25274 00000A7B 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 25275 00000A7C C3                      	retn
 25276                                  ;
 25277                                  ; M012 : END
 25278                                  ;
 25279                                  FatalErr:

 25282 00000A7F BA[4909]                	mov	dx,FEmsg

 25284 00000A84 CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 25285                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"

 25287 00000A86 E92C07                  	jmp	stall

 25289                                  	;cli

 25297                                  ;
 25298                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 25299                                  ;
 25300                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 25301                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 25302                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 25303                                  ;
 25304                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 25305                                  ;
 25306                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25307                                  
 25308                                  AllocHMA:
 25309                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 25310                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 25311                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 25312                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 25313                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 25314                                  
 25315                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 25316                                  ;
 25317                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 25318                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 25319                                  ;	push	ax
 25320                                  ;	popf
 25321                                  ;	pushf
 25322                                  ;	pop	ax
 25323                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 25324                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 25325                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 25326                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 25327                                  
 25328                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25329                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 25330                                  
 25331 00000A89 1E                      	push	ds
 25332                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 25333                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 25334                                  	; 21/10/2022
 25335 00000A8A B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 25336 00000A8D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 25337                                  
 25338 00000A8F E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 25339 00000A92 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 25340                                  
 25341 00000A94 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 25342 00000A97 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 25343                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 25344                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 25345                                  
 25346 00000A99 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 25347                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 25348 00000A9D 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 25349                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 25350                                  
 25351 00000AA1 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 25352 00000AA3 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 25353                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 25354 00000AA6 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 25355 00000AAA 48                      	dec	ax
 25356 00000AAB 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 25357                                  
 25358                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 25359                                  
 25360 00000AAD B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 25361 00000AAF CD15                    	int	15h
 25362                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 25363                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 25364                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 25365 00000AB1 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 25366                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 25367                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25368 00000AB4 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 25369                                  allocHMA_1:

 25371                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 25372 00000AB8 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 25373 00000ABC 48                      	dec	ax
 25374 00000ABD 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 25375                                  
 25376 00000ABF E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 25377 00000AC2 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 25378                                  
 25379 00000AC4 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 25380 00000AC7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 25381 00000AC9 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 25382 00000AD0 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 25383                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 25384                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25385 00000AD7 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 25386                                  
 25387                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25388                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 25389                                  ;	; cf=0
 25390                                  ;	;clc
 25391                                  ;	pop	ds
 25392                                  ;	retn
 25393

 25396                                  	; 11/12/022

 25398                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 25399 00000ADA 1F                      	pop	ds
 25400 00000ADB C3                      	retn

 25466                                  
 25467                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25468                                  ;
 25469                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 25470                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 25471                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 25472                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 25473                                  ;
 25474                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 25475                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 25476                                  ;
 25477                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25478                                  
 25479                                  StartVDHead:
 25480                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 25481                                  
 25482 00000B01 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 25483 00000B05 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 25484 00000B07 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 25485 00000B09 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 25486 00000B0B 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 25487                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 25488 00000B0C 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 25489                                  VDiskSig1:
 25490 00000B13 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 25491                                  
 25492                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 25493                                  
 25494 00000B18 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 25495                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 25496 00000B1E 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 25497 00000B2D 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 25498 00000B2F 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 25499                                  VDInt19:
 25500 00000B30 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 25501                                  OldVDInt19:
 25502 00000B31 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 25503                                  
 25504                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 25505                                  
 25506                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 25507 00000B35 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 25508                                  VDiskSig2:
 25509 00000B38 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 25510                                  
 25511                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 25512                                  
 25513 00000B3D 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 25514 00000B40 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 25515 00000B42 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 25516 00000B43 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 25517 00000B45 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 25518 00000B46 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 25519 00000B48 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 25520 00000B4A FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 25521 00000B4B 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 25522 00000B4D 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 25523 00000B4F 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 25524 00000B51 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 25525 00000B53 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 25526                                  
 25527                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 25528                                  
 25529                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25530                                  ;
 25531                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 25532                                  ;
 25533                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 25534                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 25535                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 25536                                  ;
 25537                                  ; Inputs : None
 25538                                  ;
 25539                                  ; Outputs : None
 25540                                  ;
 25541                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 25542                                  ;
 25543                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25544                                  
 25545                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25546                                  
 25547                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 25548 00000B55 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 25549 00000B57 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 25550                                  
 25551                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 25552                                  
 25553                                  	; 23/10/2022
 25554 00000B59 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 25555                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 25556 00000B5C 2EA3[310B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 25557 00000B60 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 25558                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 25559 00000B63 2EA3[330B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 25560                                  
 25561                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 25562                                  
 25563 00000B67 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 25564                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 25565                                  	; 23/10/2022
 25566 00000B69 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 25567 00000B6C CD21                    	int	21h
 25568                                  
 25569                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 25570                                  
 25571 00000B6E 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 25572 00000B6F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 25573                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 25574 00000B71 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 25575                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 25576 00000B78 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 25577 00000B7F 40                      	inc	ax
 25578 00000B80 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 25579                                  
 25580                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 25581                                  
 25582 00000B82 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 25583                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 25584 00000B83 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 25585 00000B89 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 25586                                  
 25587                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 25588                                  
 25589                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 25590 00000B8C B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 25591 00000B8F BE[010B]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 25592 00000B92 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 25593 00000B94 0E                      	push	cs
 25594 00000B95 1F                      	pop	ds
 25595 00000B96 FC                      	cld
 25596 00000B97 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 25597 00000B99 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 25598                                  
 25599                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 25600                                  
 25601                                  	; 23/10/2022
 25602 00000B9A 57                      	push	di
 25603 00000B9B 06                      	push	es
 25604                                  
 25605                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 25606                                  	;mov	es,ax
 25607                                  	; 03/09/2023
 25608 00000B9C 49                      	dec	cx
 25609                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 25610 00000B9D 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 25611                                  
 25612 00000B9F BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 25613                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 25614 00000BA2 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 25615 00000BA5 BE[350B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 25616 00000BA8 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 25617                                  
 25618 00000BAA 5F                      	pop	di
 25619 00000BAB 07                      	pop	es
 25620                                  
 25621 00000BAC C3                      	retn
 25622                                  
 25623                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25624                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 25625                                  ;
 25626                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 25627                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 25628                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 25629                                  ;
 25630                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25631                                  
 25632                                  struc desc
 25633 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 25634 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 25635 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 25636 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )

 25672                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 25673                                  
 25674                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 25675                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 25676                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 25677                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 25678                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 25679                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 25680                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 25681                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 25682                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 25683                                  ;								      ;I070
 25684                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 25685                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 25686                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 25687                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 25688                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 25689                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 25690                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 25691                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 25692                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 25693                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 25694                                  ;								      ;I070
 25695                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 25696                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 25697                                  
 25698                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25699                                  	; ds = cs
 25700                                  
 25701                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 25702                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 25703                                  
 25704 00000BFD 06                      	push	es
 25705 00000BFE 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 25706 00000C00 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 25707 00000C02 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 25708 00000C04 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 25709 00000C06 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 25710 00000C08 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 25711 00000C0A 05[DD0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 25712 00000C0D 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 25713                                  
 25714                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 25715                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 25716                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 26082                                  ;=======================================================================
 26083                                  
 26084                                  ;**	EndFile - Build DOS structures
 26085                                  ;
 26086                                  ; This procedure is called after the config.sys has been processed and
 26087                                  ; installable device drivers have been loaded (but before "install="
 26088                                  ; programs are loaded) to create the dos structures such as SFTs, buffers,
 26089                                  ; FCBs, CDSs, etc. It also loads the sysinit_base module in low memory
 26090                                  ; to allow for the safe EXECing of "install=" programs. All memory
 26091                                  ; above these structures is deallocated back to DOS.
 26092                                  ;

 26481                                  ;*******************************************************************************
 26482                                  ;									       *
 26483                                  ; function: actually allocate buffers in the memory and initialize it. 	       *
 26484                                  ; input :								       *
 26485                                  ;    memhi:memlo - start of the next available memory			       *
 26486                                  ;    buffers = number of buffers					       *
 26487                                  ;    h_buffers = number of secondary buffers				       *
 26488                                  ;									       *
 26489                                  ; output:								       *
 26490                                  ;	buffinfo.cache_count - # of caches to be installed.		       *
 26491                                  ;	buffinfo set.							       *
 26492                                  ;	bufferqueue set.						       *
 26493                                  ;									       *
 26494                                  ; subroutines to be called:						       *
 26495                                  ;									       *
 26496                                  ;*******************************************************************************
 26497                                  
 26498                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26499                                  	; (SYSINIT:0E60h)

 26748                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 26749                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 26750                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 26751                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 26752                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 26753                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 26754                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 26755                                  ;
 26756                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 26757                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 26758                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 26759                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 26760                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 26761                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 26762                                  ;
 26763                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 26764                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 26765                                  ;
 26766                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 26767                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 26768                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 26769                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 26770                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 26771                                  ;
 26772                                  ;	for round-up machine
 26773                                  ;
 26774                                  ;			  none.
 26775                                  
 26776                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 26777                                  ;
 26778                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 26779                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 26780                                  
 26781                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26782

 26964                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 26965 000010E7 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 26966 000010EA B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 26967 000010EC CD21                    	int	21h
 26968 000010EE B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 26969 000010F0 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 26970                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 26971                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 26972 000010F2 A3[6803]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 26973                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 26974 000010F5 8E06[6403]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 26975 000010F9 B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 26976 000010FB CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 26977                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 26978                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 26979                                  endfile_ret:
 26980 000010FD C3                      	retn
 26981                                  
 26982                                  ; End of "EndFile" DOS structure configuration.
 26983                                  
 26984                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26985                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26986                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 26987                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26988                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 26989                                  ;
 26990                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 26991                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 26992                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 26993                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 26994                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 26995                                  ; program).
 26996                                  
 26997                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 26998                                  
 26999                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 27000                                  
 27001 000010FE 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 27002                                  
 27003                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 27004                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 27005                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 27006                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 27007                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 27008                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 27009                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 27010                                  ; carridge return.
 27011                                  
 27012                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 27013                                  ;character after =.
 27014                                  
 27015 000010FF 06                      	push	es
 27016 00001100 1E                      	push	ds
 27017 00001101 07                      	pop	es
 27018 00001102 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 27019 00001103 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 27020                                  
 27021 00001105 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27022 00001107 FC                      	cld
 27023 00001108 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 27024 0000110E BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 27025                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 27026 00001111 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 27027                                  	; 05/09/2023
 27028 00001112 08C0                    	or	al,al
 27029                                  	;cmp	al,0
 27030 00001114 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 27031 00001116 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 27032                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 27033 00001118 AC                      	lodsb
 27034 00001119 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 27035 0000111C 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 27036 0000111E 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 27037 00001120 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 27038 00001122 47                      	inc	di
 27039 00001123 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 27040                                  done_installparm:
 27041 00001125 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 27042                                  	; 05/09/2023
 27043 0000112A 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 27044                                  	;cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 27045 0000112C 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 27046 0000112E 2EC606[F102]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 27047                                  					; starts with cr.
 27048                                  install_seg_set:
 27049                                  	; 05/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 27050 00001134 31DB                    	xor	bx, bx
 27051                                  	;mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 27052 00001136 2E891F                  	mov	[cs:bx], bx ; 05/09/2023
 27053 00001139 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 27054                                  
 27055                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 27056                                  ;
 27057                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 27058                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 27059                                  ;
 27060                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 27061                                  ;
 27062                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 27063                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 27064                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 27065                                  ;
 27066                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27067                                  
 27068                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG

 27071

 27074                                  ;%if 0

 27081                                  no_envdata2:

 27095                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 27096 00001152 2EA3[4A03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 27097                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 27098 00001156 2EA3[4E03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 27099 0000115A E86000                  	call	sum_up
 27100 0000115D 26A3[DA02]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 27101 00001161 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 27102 00001163 B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 27103 00001165 BB[4203]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 27104 00001168 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 27105 00001169 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 27106 0000116A 2EFF2E[D202]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 27107                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 27108

 27112                                  
 27113                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 27114                                  
 27115                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base

 27121 00001174 7305                            jnc     short install_exit_ret

 27158                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 27159                                  ;
 27160                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 27161                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 27162                                  ;
 27163                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 27164                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 27165                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 27166                                  
 27167                                  ParaRound:
 27168 0000117C 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 27169 0000117F D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 27170 00001181 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 27171 00001183 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 27172 00001185 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 27173 00001187 C3                      	retn
