 27175                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27176                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 27177                                  ;
 27178                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 27179                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 27180                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 27181                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 27182                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 27183                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 27184                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 27185                                  ;
 27186                                  ;in: after relocation,
 27187                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 27188                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 27189                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 27190                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 27191                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 27192                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 27193                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 27194                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 27195                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 27196                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 27197                                  ;
 27198                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 27199                                  
 27200                                  	; 24/10/2022
 27201                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 27202                                  sysinit_base:				
 27203 00001188 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 27204 0000118D 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 27205 00001192 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 27206 00001194 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 27207 00001199 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 27208 0000119E 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 27209 0000119F 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 27210 000011A0 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 27211                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 27212                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 27213 000011A2 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 27214 000011A5 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 27215 000011AA 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 27216                                  
 27217                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 27218                                  
 27219 000011AC B409                    	mov	ah,9
 27220 000011AE 0E                      	push	cs
 27221 000011AF 1F                      	pop	ds
 27222                                  	; 30/12/2022
 27223                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 27224                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 27225 000011B0 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 27226                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 27227 000011B3 CD21                    	int	21h
 27228                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 27229                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 27230                                  
 27231                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 27232                                  stall:
 27233                                  	; 24/10/2022
 27234                                  _stall: 
 27235                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27236 000011B5 F4                      	hlt 
 27237                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27238                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 27239 000011B6 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 27240                                  
 27241                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 27242 000011B8 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 27243                                  
 27244                                  ;-------------------------------------
 27245                                  
 27246                                  sum_up:
 27247                                  
 27248                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 27249                                  ;out:  ax - result
 27250                                  ;
 27251                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 27252                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 27253                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 27254                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 27255                                  ;
 27256                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 27257                                  
 27258 000011BD 1E                      	push	ds
 27259                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27260                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 27261 000011BE 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 27262                                  	; 24/10/2022
 27263                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 27264 000011C2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 27265 000011C4 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 27266 000011C6 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 27267 000011C8 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 27268                                  					; whole test better fail.
 27269 000011CD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 27270 000011CF 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 27271                                  sum1:
 27272 000011D1 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 27273 000011D3 46                      	inc	si
 27274 000011D4 46                      	inc	si
 27275 000011D5 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 27276                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 27277                                  sum_sys_code:
 27278                                  	; 24/10/2022
 27279 000011D7 BED611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27280                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27281                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 27282                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 27283                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 27284                                  	; 02/11/2022
 27285                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 27286                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 27287 000011DA B9[504E]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 27288 000011DD 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 27289 000011DF D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 27290                                  sum2:
 27291 000011E1 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 27292 000011E4 46                      	inc	si
 27293 000011E5 46                      	inc	si
 27294 000011E6 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 27295 000011E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 27296 000011E9 C3                      	retn
 27297                                  
 27298                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27299                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27300                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 27301                                  
 27302                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 27303                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 27304 000011EA 0000                    	dw	0
 27305                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 27306                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 27307 000011EC 0000                    	dw	0

 27310

 27312

 27321                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27322                                  ; Set_Buffer
 27323                                  ;
 27324                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 27325                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 27326                                  ;
 27327                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 27328                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 27329                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 27330                                  ;
 27331                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 27332                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 27333                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27334                                  
 27335                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27336                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 27337                                  
 27338                                  set_buffer:
 27339 00001209 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 27340 0000120B E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 27341 0000120E 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 27342 00001210 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 27343                                  set_buff_1:
 27344                                  	; 25/10/2022
 27345                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 27346 00001212 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 27347                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 27348 00001214 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 27349                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 27350 00001217 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 27351                                  
 27352 0000121C 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 27353 0000121E 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 27354 00001223 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 27355                                  
 27356                                  ;	for each buffer
 27357                                  
 27358                                  nxt_buff:
 27359 00001224 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 27360 00001227 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 27361 00001229 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 27362                                  
 27363 0000122B 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 27364                                  
 27365 00001230 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 27366                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 27367 00001231 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 27368 00001234 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 27369                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 27370                                  	; 25/10/2022

 27372

 27378                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 27395                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27396                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 27397                                  ;
 27398                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 27399                                  ;
 27400                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 27401                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 27402                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27403                                  
 27404                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 27405                                  GetBufferAddr:
 27406 00001263 53                      	push	bx
 27407 00001264 52                      	push	dx
 27408 00001265 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 27409 00001269 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 27410                                  	;add	ax,0Fh

 27465                                  
 27466                                  ; ======================================================================
 27467                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 27468                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27469                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27470                                  
 27471                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27472                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 27473                                  ;
 27474                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 27475                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 27476                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 27477                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 27478                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 27479                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 27480                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 27481                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 27482                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 27483                                  ;
 27484                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 27485                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 27486                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 27487                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 27488                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 27489                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 27490                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 27491                                  ;	conditions:
 27492                                  ;
 27493                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 27494                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 27495                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 27496                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 27497                                  ;
 27498                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 27499                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 27500                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 27501                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 27502                                  ;
 27503                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 27504                                  ;
 27505                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 27506                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 27507                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 27508                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 27509                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 27510                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 27511                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 27512                                  ;	interrupt line.
 27513                                  ;
 27514                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 27515                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 27516                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 27517                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 27518                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 27519                                  ;
 27520                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 27521                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 27522                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 27523                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 27524                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 27525                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 27526                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 27527                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 27528                                  ;
 27529                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 27530                                  
 27531                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27532                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 27533                                  
 27534                                  	; 14/12/2022
 27535                                  stackinit:
 27536 000012B0 50                      	push	ax
 27537 000012B1 1E                      	push	ds
 27538 000012B2 06                      	push	es
 27539 000012B3 53                      	push	bx
 27540 000012B4 51                      	push	cx
 27541 000012B5 52                      	push	dx
 27542 000012B6 57                      	push	di
 27543 000012B7 56                      	push	si
 27544 000012B8 55                      	push	bp
 27545                                  
 27546                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 27547                                  
 27548                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27549                                  	; ds = cs
 27550 000012B9 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 27551 000012BC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 27552                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27553                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 27554                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 27555 000012BE 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 27556                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 27557 000012C2 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 27558 000012C5 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 27559                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27560 000012C9 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 27561                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27562                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)

 27565                                  	; 12/12/2022

 27567 000012D2 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]

 27569                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 27570                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 27571 000012D5 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax

 27574

 27576

 27595

 27603                                  
 27604                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 27605

 27613                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space

 28373                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28374                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28375                                  
 28376                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 28377                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 28378                                  
 28379                                  new_init_loop:
 28380                                  
 28381                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 28382                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 28383                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 28384                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 28385                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 28386                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 28387                                  
 28388 000014A2 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 28389 000014A5 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 28390 000014A7 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 28391 000014AB 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 28392                                  
 28393 000014AE 1E                      	push	ds
 28394                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 28395                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 28396                                  	; 21/10/2022
 28397 000014AF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 28398 000014B2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 28399 000014B4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 28400 000014B7 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 28401 000014B9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 28402 000014BD 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 28403 000014C0 1F                      	pop	ds
 28404                                  
 28405 000014C1 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 28406 000014C4 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 28407 000014C8 C3                      	retn
 28408                                  
 28409                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 28410                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28411                                  
 28412                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28413                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 28414                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 28415                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 28416                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 28417                                  ;out: devmark established.
 28418                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 28419                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 28420                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28421                                  
 28422                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 28423                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 28424                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 28425                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 28426                                  
 28427                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 28428                                  
 28429                                  setdevmark:
 28430                                  
 28431                                  	; 04/09/2023
 28432                                  	;push	es
 28433                                  	;push	cx
 28434                                  
 28435 000014C9 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 28436 000014CE 2E890E[EC14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 28437 000014D3 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 28438                                  	; 25/10/2022
 28439                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 28440 000014D5 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 28441 000014D9 41                      	inc	cx
 28442                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 28443 000014DA 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 28444                                  
 28445                                  	; 04/09/2023
 28446                                  	;pop	cx
 28447                                  	;pop	es
 28448                                  	
 28449 000014DF 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 28450 000014E4 C3                      	retn

 28460                                                                          ; allocation strategy call
 28461                                  
 28462                                  ;have_install_cmd equ 00000001b 	; config.sys has install= commands
 28463                                  ;has_installed	  equ 00000010b 	; sysinit_base installed.
 28464                                  
 28465                                  default_filenum equ 8
 28466                                  
 28467                                  ;stacksw	equ true		; include switchable hardware stacks
 28468                                  
 28469                                  ; external variable defined in ibmbio module for multi-track
 28470                                  
 28471                                  ;multrk_on	equ 10000000b		;user spcified mutitrack=on,or system turns
 28472                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
 28473                                  					; default value,if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.

 28626 00000018 <res Ah>                	 resw 5
 28627                                   .size:

 28635                                  					;AN000; DS:SI will points to DBCS EV

 28638                                  					;AN000; following parameters are set
 28639                                  					;AN000; to get casemap table.
 28640                                  _$P_DOSTBL_Def	   equ	-1		;AN000; get default
 28641                                  _$P_DOSTBL_BL	   equ	5		;AN000; buffer length for Tbl pointer
 28642                                  _$P_DOSTBL_File	   equ	4		;AN000; get file uppercase table

 28644                                  					; By this call following information
 28645                                  					; is returned.

 28647 00000000 ??                       .InfoID: resb 1			;AN000; information id for the table
 28648 00000001 ????                     .Off:	 resw 1				;AN000; offset address of the table
 28649 00000003 ????                     .Seg:	 resw 1				;AN000; segment address of the table
 28650                                  endstruc
 28651                                  
 28652                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28653                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 28654                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 28655                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 28656                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 28657                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 28658                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 28659                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 28660                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 28661                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 28662                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28663                                  
 28664                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 28665                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 28666 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 28667 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 28668 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 28669                                  endstruc
 28670                                  
 28671                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 28672                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 28673                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 28674                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 28675                                  
 28676                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28677                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 28678                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 28679                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 28680                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 28681                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 28682                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 28683                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 28684                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 28685                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 28686                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 28687                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28688                                  
 28689                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 28690                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 28691 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 28692 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 28693 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 28694                                  endstruc
 28695                                  
 28696                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28697                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 28698                                  ;
 28699                                  ;
 28700                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 28701                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 28702                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28703                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28704                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28705                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28706                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28707                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28708                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28709                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28710                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28711                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 28712                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 28713                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 28714                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 28715                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 28716                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 28717                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 28718                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 28719                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 28720                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 28721                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 28722                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 28723                                  ;	   :
 28724                                  ;
 28725                                  ;Note:
 28726                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 28727                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 28728                                  ;
 28729                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 28730                                  ;
 28731                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 28732                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 28733                                  ;
 28734                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 28735                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 28736                                  ;
 28737                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 28738                                  ;
 28739                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 28740                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 28741                                  ;
 28742                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28743                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 28744                                  ;
 28745                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 28746                                  ;
 28747                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28748                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 28749                                  ;
 28750                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 28751                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 28752                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 28753                                  ;
 28754                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 28755                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 28756                                  ;
 28757                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 28758                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 28759                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 28760                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28761                                  
 28762                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 28763                                  
 28764                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 28765                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 28766                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 28767                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 28768                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 28769                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 28770                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 28771                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 28772                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 28773                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 28774                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 28775                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 28776                                  
 28777                                  ;**** Function flags
 28778                                  
 28779                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 28780                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 28781                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 28782                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 28783                                  
 28784                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 28785                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 28786 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 28787 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 28788 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 28789 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 28790 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 28791 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 28792                                  endstruc
 28793                                  
 28794                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28795                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 28796                                  ;
 28797                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 28798                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 28799                                  ;	     +-
 28800                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 28801                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 28802                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 28803                                  ;	     |	:
 28804                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 28805                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 28806                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 28807                                  ;	     |	:
 28808                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 28809                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 28810                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 28811                                  ;	     +-	:
 28812                                  ;
 28813                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 28814                                  ;
 28815                                  ;Note:
 28816                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 28817                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 28818                                  ;
 28819                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 28820                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 28821                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 28822                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28823                                  
 28824                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 28825                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 28826                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 28827                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 28828                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 28829                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 28830                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 28831                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 28832                                  
 28833                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 28834 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 28835 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 28836 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 28837 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 28838 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 28839                                  endstruc
 28840                                  
 28841                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28842                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 28843                                  ;
 28844                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 28845                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 28846                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 28847                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 28848                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 28849                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 28850                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 28851                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 28852                                  ;
 28853                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 28854                                  ;
 28855                                  ;            +-
 28856                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 28857                                  ;	    | or
 28858                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 28859                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 28860                                  ;	    | or
 28861                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 28862                                  ;	    | or
 28863                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 28864                                  ;	    | or
 28865                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 28866                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 28867                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 28868                                  ;	    | or
 28869                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 28870                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 28871                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 28872                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 28873                                  ;	    +-
 28874                                  ;
 28875                                  ;
 28876                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 28877                                  ;      list.
 28878                                  ;
 28879                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 28880                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 28881                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 28882                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28883                                  
 28884                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 28885                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 28886 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 28887 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 28888 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 28889 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 28890                                  endstruc
 28891                                  
 28892                                  ;--------------------------------
 28893                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 28894                                  
 28895                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 28896                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 28897                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 28898                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 28899                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 28900                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 28901                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 28902                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 28903                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 28904                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 28905                                  
 28906                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 28907                                  
 28908                                  ;**** Return code
 28909                                  ;
 28910                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 28911                                  
 28912                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 28913                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 28914                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 28915                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 28916                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 28917                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 28918                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 28919                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 28920                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error

 29003                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 29007                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29008                                  ; SysParse;
 29009                                  ;
 29010                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 29011                                  ;
 29012                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 29013                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 29014                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 29015                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 29016                                  ;
 29017                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 29018                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 29019                                  ;		 is in DS.
 29020                                  ;
 29021                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 29022                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 29023                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 29024                                  ;
 29025                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 29026                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 29027                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 29028                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 29029                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 29030                                  ;
 29031                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 29032                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 29033                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 29034                                  ;
 29035                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 29036                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 29037                                  ;
 29038                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 29039                                  ;
 29040                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 29041                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 29042                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 29043                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 29044                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 29045                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 29046                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 29047                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 29048                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 29049                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 29050                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 29051                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 29052                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 29053                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 29054                                  ;	     (tm08)

 29056                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)

 29075                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 29076                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.

 29085                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 29086                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 29087                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 29088                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 29089                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 29090

 29092                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 29093                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 29094                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 29095                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 29096                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control

 29704                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29705                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 29706                                  ;
 29707                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 29708                                  ;
 29709                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 29710                                  ;	    AL = type
 29711                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 29712                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 29713                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 29714                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 29715                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 29716                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 29717                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 29718                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 29719                                  ;

 29721                                  ;
 29722                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 29723                                  ;
 29724                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 29725                                  ;***********************************************************************

 29944                                  ;
 29945                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 29946                                  ;
 29947                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed

 29954                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:

 29959 000018DE 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?

 29961

 29986                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 29987                                  ;
 29988                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 29989                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 29990                                  ;
 29991                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 29992                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 29993                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 29994                                  ;
 29995                                  ; Output:   None
 29996                                  ;
 29997                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 29998                                  ;***********************************************************************

 30000                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 30001 000018FF 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 30002 00001900 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 30003 00001901 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 30004                                  
 30005                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 30006 00001903 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 30007 00001906 E80304                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 30008 00001909 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 30009                                  
 30010 0000190B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 30011 0000190D 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 30012                                  
 30013 0000190F E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 30014 00001912 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 30015 00001915 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 30016                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 30017 00001917 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 30018                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 30019 00001918 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 30020 00001919 EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 30021                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 30022 0000191B 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 30023 0000191C 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 30024 0000191D C3                      	retn

 30121                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30122                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 30123                                  ;
 30124                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 30125                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 30126                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 30127                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 30128                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 30129                                  ;
 30130                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 30131                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 30132                                  ;
 30133                                  ; Output:    None
 30134                                  ;
 30135                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 30136                                  ;
 30137                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 30138                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30139                                  
 30140                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30141                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 30142                                  
 30143                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 30144                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 30145                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 30146 0000195F 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 30147 00001960 2E800E[0215]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 30148 00001966 2E8026[0215]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 30149                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 30150 0000196C 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 30151 0000196F 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 30152 00001971 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 30153                                  
 30154 00001973 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 30155 00001975 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 30156                                  
 30157 00001977 2E800E[0215]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 30158                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 30159 0000197D 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 30160                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 30161 0000197E E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 30162 00001981 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 30163 00001982 C3                      	retn

 30425                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 30426                                  ;
 30427                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 30428                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 30429                                  ;
 30430                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 30431                                  ;
 30432                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 30433                                  ;
 30434                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 30435                                  ;***********************************************************************

 31076                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 31077                                  ;
 31078                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.

 31177                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31178                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 31179                                  ;
 31180                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 31181                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 31182                                  ;
 31183                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 31184                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 31185                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 31186                                  ;
 31187                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 31188                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 31189                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 31190                                  
 31191                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 31192                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 31193                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 31194                                  ;
 31195                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 31196                                  
 31197                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 31198                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31199                                  
 31200                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 31201                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 31202                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 31203                                  	; 08/07/2023
 31204 00001CF3 BD[0B15]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 31205                                  
 31206                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 31207 00001CF6 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 31208 00001CF8 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 31209                                  
 31210                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 31211 00001CFA 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 31212 00001CFC 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 31213                                  
 31214 00001CFE F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 31215                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 31216                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31217 00001CFF C3                      	retn
 31218                                  
 31219                                  ; 12/12/2022
 31220                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 31221                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 31222                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 31223                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 31224                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 31225                                  
 31226                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 31227                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 31228 00001D00 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 31229 00001D02 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 31230                                  
 31231 00001D04 2E800E[0215]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 31232                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 31233                                  
 31234                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31235                                  	; cf=0
 31236                                  	;retn
 31237                                  
 31238                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 31239                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31240                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 31241 00001D0A F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 31242                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 31243                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 31244 00001D0B C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 31245                                  
 31246                                  ;**************************************************************************
 31247                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 31248                                  ;
 31249                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 31250                                  ;
 31251                                  ;  Input:
 31252                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 31253                                  ;
 31254                                  ;  Output:
 31255                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 31256                                  ;
 31257                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 31258                                  ;
 31259                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 31260                                  ;***************************************************************************
 31261                                  
 31262                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 31263 00001D0C 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 31264 00001D0D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 31265 00001D0E 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 31266                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 31267                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 31268                                  	; 08/07/2023
 31269 00001D0F 2E8B36[FF14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 31270 00001D14 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 31271 00001D16 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 31272 00001D18 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 31273 00001D19 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 31274 00001D1A 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 31275 00001D1B 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 31276 00001D1C 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 31277 00001D1D 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 31278 00001D1E 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 31279                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 31280                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 31281 00001D1F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 31282 00001D21 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 31283 00001D24 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 31284                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 31285 00001D26 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 31286 00001D28 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 31287 00001D2A 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 31288 00001D2B 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 31289 00001D2C 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 31290 00001D2D 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 31291 00001D2E 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 31292 00001D2F 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 31293 00001D30 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 31294 00001D31 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 31295                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 31296 00001D33 2E8936[FD14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 31297 00001D38 2E891E[FF14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 31298                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 31299                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 31300                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 31301                                  	; 08/07/2023
 31302 00001D3D 2EC536[FD14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 31303                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 31304 00001D42 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 31305 00001D45 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 31306 00001D47 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 31307 00001D49 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 31308 00001D4B 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 31309 00001D4E 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 31310 00001D50 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 31311 00001D51 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 31312                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 31313 00001D53 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 31314 00001D54 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 31315                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 31316 00001D55 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 31317                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 31318                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31319                                  	; cf=0
 31320                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 31321                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 31322 00001D57 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 31323 00001D58 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 31324 00001D59 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 31325 00001D5A C3                      	retn				;AN000;
