 31892                                  
 31893                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 31894                                  ;
 31895                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 31896                                  ;
 31897                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31898                                  ;
 31899                                  ;   Modification log:
 31900                                  ;
 31901                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 31902                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 31903                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 31904                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 31905                                  ;
 31906                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31907                                  ;
 31908                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 31909                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 31910                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 31911                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 31912                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 31913                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 31914                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 31915                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 31916                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 31917                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 31918                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 31919                                  ;
 31920                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31921                                  
 31922                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 31923                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 31924                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 31925                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 31926                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 31927                                  
 31928                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 31929                                  
 31930                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 31931                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 31932                                  
 31933                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 31934                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 31935                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 31936                                  
 31937                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 31938                                  ;
 31939                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 31940                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 31941                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 31942                                  ;	           line.
 31943                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 31944                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 31945                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 31946                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 31947                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 31948                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 31949                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 31950                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 31951                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 31952                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 31953                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 31954                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 31955                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 31956                                  ;	           for details).
 31957                                  
 31958 00001F5A 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 31959 00001F5B 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 31960 00001F5C 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 31961 00001F5E 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 31962 00001F5F 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 31963 00001F6F 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 31964 00001F8F 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 31965 00001F90 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 31966 00001F91 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 31967                                  
 31968                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 31969                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 31970                                  
 31971                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 31972                                  
 31973                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 31974                                  
 31975                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 31986 00001F94 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 31987 00001F96 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 31988 00001F98 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver

 31995 00001FA2 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)

 32024                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32025                                  
 32026                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32027                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 32028                                  
 32029                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32030                                  ;
 32031                                  ; procedure : doconf
 32032                                  ;
 32033                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 32034                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 32035                                  ;
 32036                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32037                                  
 32038                                  	; 27/10/2022
 32039                                  doconf:
 32040 00001FC6 0E                      	push	cs
 32041 00001FC7 1F                      	pop	ds
 32042                                  
 32043 00001FC8 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 32044                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 32045 00001FCB CD21                    	int	21h
 32046 00001FCD 8816[7346]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 32047                                  
 32048                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 32049                                  ; 27/10/2022
 32050                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 32051                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 32052 00001FD1 8816[7146]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 32053                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 32054                                  
 32055 00001FD5 BA[8845]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 32056 00001FD8 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 32057                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 32058 00001FDB F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 32059 00001FDC CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 32060 00001FDE 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 32061                                  
 32062                                  ; 31/12/2022
 32063                                  ; 27/10/2022
 32064                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 32065 00001FE0 E8F918                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 32066                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 32067                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 32068 00001FE3 C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 32069 00001FE8 C3                      	retn
 32070                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 32071 00001FE9 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 32072 00001FEB 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 32073 00001FED 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 32074                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 32075 00001FEF B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 32076 00001FF2 CD21                    	int	21h
 32077 00001FF4 A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 32078                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 32079 00001FF7 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 32080                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 32081                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 32082                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 32083                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 32084                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 32085                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 32086 00001FF9 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 32087 00001FFC CD21                    	int	21h
 32088                                  
 32089                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 32090 00001FFE 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 32091                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32092                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 32093                                  
 32094 00002002 A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 32095 00002005 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 32096 00002008 E871F1                  	call	ParaRound
 32097 0000200B 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 32098                                  
 32099                                  ; 31/12/2022
 32100                                  ; 27/10/2022
 32101                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 32102                                  ;
 32103                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 32104                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 32105                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 32106                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 32107                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 32108                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 32109                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 32110                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 32111                                  ;
 32112 0000200D 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 32113 0000200E 8916[E714]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 32114 00002012 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 32115                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 32116                                  
 32117 00002014 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header

 32287                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 32288                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 32289                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 32290                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 32291                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 32292                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 32293                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 32294                                  ;   spot.
 32295                                  ;
 32296                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 32297                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 32298                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 32299                                  ;   retrieved.

 32496                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32497                                  ; buffer command
 32498                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32499                                  
 32500                                  ;******************************************************************************
 32501                                  ;									      *
 32502                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 32503                                  ;									      *
 32504                                  ; input :								      *
 32505                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 32506                                  ; output:								      *
 32507                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 32508                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 32509                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 32510                                  ;									      *
 32511                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 32512                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 32513                                  ; logic:								      *
 32514                                  ; {									      *
 32515                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 32516                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 32517                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 32518                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 32519                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 32520                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 32521                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 32522                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 32523                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 32524                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 32525                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 32526                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 32527                                  ;	};								      *
 32528                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 32529                                  ; };									      *
 32530                                  ;									      *
 32531                                  ;******************************************************************************
 32532                                  
 32533                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32534                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 32535                                  tryb:
 32536 00002188 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 32537 0000218B 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 32538                                  
 32539                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32540                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 32541                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32542                                  ;%if 0
 32543                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 32544 0000218D E8431F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 32545 00002190 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 32546                                  ;endif
 32547                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 32548                                  
 32549                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32550                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32551 00002192 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 32552                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 32553 00002194 880E[A21D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 32554                                  
 32555 00002198 BF[5B1D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 32556                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 32557                                  	; 03/01/2023
 32558                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 32559                                  do7:
 32560 0000219B E87E07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 32561 0000219E 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 32562                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 32563                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 32564                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32565                                  ;sr7:
 32566                                  	;jmp	coff
 32567                                  	; 03/01/2023
 32568 000021A0 E9A806                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 32569                                  if7:
 32570 000021A3 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 32571 000021A6 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 32572                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 32573 000021A8 813E[A61D][9B1D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 32574                                  	;jne	short if11
 32575                                  	; 31/12/2022
 32576 000021AE 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11

 32579                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 32580                                  if11:
 32581                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 32582 000021B0 A1[A81D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 32583 000021B3 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1

 32626                                  ;****************************************************************************
 32627                                  ;									    *
 32628                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 32629                                  ;									    *

 32631                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *

 32643                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 32644                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *

 32646                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 32647                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *

 32649                                  ;	};								    *

 32651                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 32652                                  ; };									    *
 32653                                  ;									    *

 34236                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34237                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 34238                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 34239                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 34240                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 34241                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 34242                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 34243                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 34244                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34245                                  
 34246                                  ;**************************************************************************
 34247                                  ;									  *
 34248                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 34249                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 34250                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 34251                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 34252                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 34253                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 34254                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 34255                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 34256                                  ; input :								  *
 34257                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 34258                                  ; output:								  *
 34259                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 34260                                  ;									  *
 34261                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 34262                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 34263                                  ; logic:								  *
 34264                                  ; {									  *
 34265                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 34266                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 34267                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 34268                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 34269                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 34270                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 34271                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 34272                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 34273                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 34274                                  ;	     }								  *
 34275                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 34276                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 34277                                  ;	};								  *
 34278                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 34279                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 34280                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 34281                                  ; };									  *
 34282                                  ;**************************************************************************
 34283

 35042                                  ;	 procedure.

 35392                                  ;
 35393                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 35394                                  ;
 35395                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 35396                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 35397                                  ;
 35398                                  ;	Output : none
 35399                                  ;
 35400                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 35401                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 35402                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 35403                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 35404                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 35405                                  ;
 35406                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35407                                  
 35408                                  LieInt12Mem:
 35409                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35410                                  	; ds = cs
 35411 000029C1 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 35412                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 35413                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 35414 000029C4 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 35415 000029C7 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 35416                                  	; 13/05/2019
 35417                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 35418                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 35419                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 35420                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35421                                  	; ds = cs
 35422 000029C9 803E[B01F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 35423 000029CE 74F0                    	je	short limx
 35424 000029D0 A1[961F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 35425                                  lim_set:
 35426                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35427                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35428                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 35429                                  ;limx:
 35430                                  	;retn
 35431                                  	
 35432                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 35433                                  
 35434                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35435                                  ;
 35436                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 35437                                  ;
 35438                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 35439                                  ;	Output : none
 35440                                  ;
 35441                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 35442                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 35443                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 35444                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 35445                                  ;
 35446                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35447                                  
 35448                                  	; 01/11/2022
 35449                                  SetInt12Mem:
 35450 000029D3 1E                      	push	ds
 35451 000029D4 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 35452 000029D7 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 35453 000029D9 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 35454 000029DD 2E891E[B41F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 35455 000029E2 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 35456 000029E4 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 35457 000029E6 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 35458 000029E9 2EC606[B31F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 35459 000029EF 1F                      	pop	ds
 35460                                  ;limx:
 35461 000029F0 C3                      	retn
 35462                                  
 35463                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35464                                  ;
 35465                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 35466                                  ;
 35467                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 35468                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 35469                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 35470                                  ;
 35471                                  ;	Output : none
 35472                                  ;
 35473                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 35474                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 35475                                  ;
 35476                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35477                                  
 35478                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 35479                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35480                                  	; ds = cs
 35481 000029F1 803E[B31F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35482                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 35483                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 35484                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 35485 000029F6 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 35486                                  	; 18/12/2022
 35487 000029F8 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 35488 000029FB 8826[B31F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 35489                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35490                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 35491 000029FF 1E                      	push	ds
 35492                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 35493 00002A00 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 35494 00002A02 2EA1[B41F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 35495 00002A06 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 35496 00002A09 1F                      	pop	ds
 35497                                  timx:
 35498 00002A0A C3                      	retn

 35531                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35532                                  
 35533                                  UpdatePDB:
 35534 00002A23 1E                      	push	ds
 35535 00002A24 B462                    	mov	ah,62h
 35536 00002A26 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET PSP ADDRESS
 35537 00002A28 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 35538 00002A2A 2E8B1E[A502]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 35539                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 35540 00002A2F 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 35541 00002A33 1F                      	pop	ds
 35542 00002A34 C3                      	retn

 35547                                  
 35548                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35549                                  ;%if 0
 35550                                  
 35551                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35552                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 35553                                  
 35554                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 35555                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 35556                                  
 35557                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35558                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 35559                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35560                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35561                                  
 35562                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35563                                  ;
 35564                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 35565                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 35566                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 35567                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 35568                                  ;
 35569                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 35570                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 35571                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 35572                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 35573                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 35574                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 35575                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 35576                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 35577                                  ; available during the load.
 35578                                  ;
 35579                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 35580                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 35581                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 35582                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 35583                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 35584                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 35585                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 35586                                  ;
 35587                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 35588                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 35589                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 35590                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 35591                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 35592                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 35593                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 35594                                  ;
 35595                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35596                                  
 35597                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 35598                                  
 35599                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 35600                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 35601                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 35602                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 35603                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 35604                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 35605                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 35606                                  
 35607                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 35608                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 35609                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 35610                                  
 35611                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35612                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 35613                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35614                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 35615                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 35616                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 35617                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 35618                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35619                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 35620                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 35621                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35622                                  
 35623                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35624                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 35625                                  
 35626                                  InitVar:
 35627                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35628                                  	; ds = cs
 35629                                  
 35630                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 35631                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35632                                  	;push	ax
 35633                                  	;push	cx
 35634                                  	;push	di
 35635 00002A35 06                      	push	es
 35636                                  
 35637                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 35638 00002A36 0E                      	push	cs
 35639 00002A37 07                      	pop	es
 35640                                  
 35641 00002A38 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 35642                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 35643                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 35644                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 35645                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 35646                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 35647                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 35648                                  
 35649                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35650                                  	; ds = cs
 35651 00002A3A A2[5B1F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 35652 00002A3D A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 35653 00002A40 A3[5C1F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 35654 00002A43 C606[5E1F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 35655                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 35656 00002A48 A2[911F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 35657                                  
 35658 00002A4B FC                      	cld
 35659                                  
 35660 00002A4C B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 35661 00002A4F BF[5F1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 35662 00002A52 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 35663                                  
 35664                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 35665                                  	; 01/01/2033
 35666 00002A54 B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 35667 00002A56 BF[6F1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 35668 00002A59 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 35669                                  
 35670                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 35671                                  
 35672                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 35673 00002A5B 07                      	pop	es
 35674                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35675                                  	;pop	di
 35676                                  	;pop	cx
 35677                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 35678                                  
 35679 00002A5C C3                      	retn
 35680                                  
 35681                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35682                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 35683                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35684                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 35685                                  ; EXIT    : None
 35686                                  ; ERROR   : None
 35687                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 35688                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35689                                  
 35690                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35691                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 35692                                  FixMem:
 35693                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35694                                  	;push	ax
 35695                                  	;push	bx
 35696                                  	;push	cx
 35697                                  	;push	dx
 35698 00002A5D 06                      	push	es
 35699                                  
 35700 00002A5E E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 35701                                  
 35702 00002A61 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 35703 00002A64 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 35704                                  
 35705 00002A66 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 35706                                  
 35707                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 35708                                  
 35709 00002A68 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 35710 00002A6A 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 35711 00002A6C 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 35712                                  
 35713                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35714                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 35715                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 35716                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35717                                  
 35718 00002A6D 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 35719 00002A71 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 35720 00002A76 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 35721 00002A78 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 35722                                  
 35723                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 35724                                  
 35725 00002A7A 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 35726 00002A7F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 35727 00002A81 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 35728                                  
 35729 00002A85 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 35730                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 35731                                  	; 11/07/2023
 35732 00002A8A 43                      	inc	bx
 35733 00002A8B 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 35734                                  
 35735                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 35736                                  
 35737 00002A90 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 35738 00002A92 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 35739                                  
 35740 00002A97 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 35741 00002A99 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 35742 00002A9E 43                      	inc	bx
 35743 00002A9F 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 35744                                  
 35745                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 35746 00002AA1 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 35747 00002AA3 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 35748                                  fmX:	
 35749 00002AA5 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 35750                                  
 35751 00002AA8 07                      	pop	es
 35752                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35753                                  	;pop	dx
 35754                                  	;pop	cx
 35755                                  	;pop	bx
 35756                                  	;pop	ax
 35757                                  
 35758 00002AA9 C3                      	retn
 35759                                  
 35760                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35761                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 35762                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35763                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 35764                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 35765                                  ; ERROR:    None
 35766                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 35767                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35768                                  
 35769                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 35770                                  fm_link:
 35771 00002AAA B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 35772 00002AAD CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 35773                                  
 35774                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 35775                                  	;
 35776                                  	;push	es
 35777                                  	;push	cs
 35778                                  	;pop	es
 35779                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 35780                                  	;pop	es
 35781                                  	
 35782                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35783                                  	; ds = cs
 35784                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 35785 00002AAF A2[8F1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 35786                                  
 35787 00002AB2 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 35788 00002AB5 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 35789 00002AB8 CD21                    	int	21h
 35790 00002ABA C3                      	retn
 35791                                  
 35792                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35793                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 35794                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35795                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 35796                                  ; EXIT:     None
 35797                                  ; ERROR:    None
 35798                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 35799                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35800                                  
 35801                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 35802                                  fm_unlink:
 35803 00002ABB 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 35804                                  	
 35805                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 35806                                  	;
 35807                                  	;push	ds
 35808                                  	;push	cs
 35809                                  	;pop	ds
 35810                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 35811                                  	;pop	ds
 35812                                  	
 35813                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35814                                  	; ds = cs
 35815                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 35816 00002ABD 8A1E[8F1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 35817                                  
 35818 00002AC1 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 35819 00002AC4 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 35820 00002AC6 C3                      	retn
 35821                                  
 35822                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35823                                  
 35824                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35825                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 35826                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 35827                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35828                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 35829                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 35830                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 35831                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 35832                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35833                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 35834                                  ;
 35835                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 35836                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 35837                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 35838                                  ;
 35839                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 35840                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 35841                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 35842                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 35843                                  ;
 35844                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 35845                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 35846                                  ;
 35847                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35848                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 35849                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 35850                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 35851                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 35852                                  ;     lh
 35853                                  ;     /l
 35854                                  ;     1
 35855                                  ;     1000
 35856                                  ;     2
 35857                                  ;     print
 35858                                  ;     /d
 35859                                  ;     :lpt2
 35860                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 35861                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 35862                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 35863                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 35864                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 35865                                  ; for:
 35866                                  ;    Each /L
 35867                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 35868                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 35869                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 35870                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 35871                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 35872                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35873                                  
 35874                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35875                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 35876                                  
 35877                                  ParseVar:
 35878                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 35879                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35880                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 35881 00002AC7 1E                      	push	ds
 35882 00002AC8 06                      	push	es
 35883                                  
 35884 00002AC9 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 35885 00002ACA 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 35886 00002ACB FC                      	cld
 35887                                  
 35888                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 35889                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 35890                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 35891                                  
 35892 00002ACC AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 35893 00002ACD E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 35894 00002AD0 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 35895                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 35896 00002AD2 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 35897 00002AD4 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 35898                                  
 35899 00002AD6 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 35900 00002AD7 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 35901 00002AD8 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 35902                                  
 35903 00002ADA AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 35904                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 35905 00002ADB 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 35906                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 35907 00002ADD 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 35908 00002ADF 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 35909                                  
 35910                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 35911 00002AE1 2EFE06[911F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 35912                                  
 35913                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 35914                                  	;
 35915                                  	;push	es
 35916                                  	;push	cs
 35917                                  	;pop	es
 35918                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 35919                                  	;pop	es
 35920                                  
 35921 00002AE6 2EC606[5B1F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 35922                                  
 35923 00002AEC EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 35924                                  
 35925                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 35926 00002AEE 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 35927 00002AF0 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 35928                                  
 35929                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 35930 00002AF2 2EFE06[911F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 35931                                  
 35932 00002AF7 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 35933 00002AFA 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 35934                                  
 35935 00002AFC 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 35936 00002AFD EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 35937                                  
 35938                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 35939 00002AFF B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 35940 00002B02 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 35941 00002B03 4E                      	dec	si
 35942 00002B04 F9                      	stc
 35943                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 35944 00002B05 07                      	pop	es
 35945 00002B06 1F                      	pop	ds
 35946                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35947                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 35948 00002B07 C3                      	retn
 35949                                  
 35950                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35951                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 35952                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35953                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 35954                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 35955                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 35956                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 35957                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35958                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 35959                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 35960                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 35961                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 35962                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35963                                  
 35964                                  parseL:
 35965 00002B08 AC                      	lodsb
 35966 00002B09 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 35967 00002B0B 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 35968                                  
 35969                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35970                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 35971                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35972                                  
 35973 00002B0D E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 35974 00002B10 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 35975 00002B12 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 35976                                  
 35977 00002B15 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 35978 00002B17 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 35979 00002B1A 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 35980                                  
 35981                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 35982 00002B1C 2EFE06[911F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35983                                  
 35984 00002B21 AC                      	lodsb
 35985 00002B22 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 35986 00002B24 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 35987                                  
 35988 00002B26 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 35989 00002B29 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 35990                                  
 35991 00002B2B E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?

 36159                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36160                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 36161                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 36162                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 36163                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 36164                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36165                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 36166                                  ; EXIT:     None
 36167                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 36168                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 36169                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36170                                  
 36171                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36172                                  stowUMB:
 36173 00002B90 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 36174 00002B92 7202                    	jb	short su10
 36175 00002B94 F9                      	stc
 36176 00002B95 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 36177                                  su10:	
 36178                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36179                                  	;push	bx
 36180                                  	;push	di
 36181                                  	;push	si
 36182                                  	;push	ds
 36183                                  	;push	es
 36184                                  	;push	cs
 36185                                  	;pop	es
 36186                                  	;push	cs
 36187                                  	;pop	ds
 36188                                  
 36189                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36190                                  	; ds <> cs
 36191                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 36192 00002B96 2E803E[5E1F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 36193                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 36194 00002B9C 7504                    	jne	short su20
 36195 00002B9E 2EA2[5E1F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 36196                                  
 36197                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 36198                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 36199                                  	;jne	short su20
 36200                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 36201                                  su20:

 36203 00002BA4 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.

 36218                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 36221

 36224 00002BB3 F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1

 36226                                  	; 01/01/2023
