 40960                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 40961                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 40962                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 40963                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 40964                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 40965                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 40966                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 40967                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 40968                                  ;
 40969                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40970                                  
 40971                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 40972                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 40973                                  
 40974                                  skip_comment:
 40975 000038A6 E3EA                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 40976                                  
 40977                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40978                                  	; ds = cs	
 40979                                  
 40980 000038A8 803E[5003]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 40981                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 40982 000038AD 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 40983                                  
 40984 000038AF 803E[5103]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 40985                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 40986 000038B4 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 40987                                  
 40988 000038B6 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 40989                                  	
 40990 000038B9 3806[5203]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 40991                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 40992 000038BD 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 40993                                  
 40994 000038BF 803E[5103]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 40995                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 40996 000038C4 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 40997                                  
 40998 000038C6 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 40999                                  	
 41000 000038CA 3806[5303]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 41001                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 41002 000038CE 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 41003                                  skip_cmmt:
 41004 000038D0 E3C0                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 41005 000038D2 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 41006 000038D5 46                      	inc	si
 41007 000038D6 49                      	dec	cx
 41008 000038D7 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 41009 000038D9 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 41010                                  no_commt:

 41022                                  ;
 41023                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 41024                                  ;
 41025                                  ;   INPUT
 41026                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 41027                                  ;
 41028                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41029                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 41030                                  ;
 41031                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41032                                  ;       All
 41033                                  ;
 41034                                  ;   HISTORY
 41035                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 41036                                  ;
 41037                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41038                                  
 41039                                  kbd_read:
 41040 000038DC F606[3847]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 41041 000038E1 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 41042                                  
 41043 000038E3 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 41044 000038E4 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 41045 000038E6 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 41046                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 41047                                  kbd_loop:
 41048 000038E8 B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 41049 000038EA CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 41050 000038EC 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 41051 000038EE B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 41052 000038F0 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41053 000038F2 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 41054 000038F4 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 41055 000038F6 A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 41056                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 41057                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41058 000038F9 2E2B06[8C03]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 41059                                  
 41060 000038FE 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 41061 00003900 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 41062                                  kbd_loopdone:
 41063 00003902 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 41064                                  kbd_nodelay:
 41065 00003903 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 41066 00003905 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 41067 00003907 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41068 00003909 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 41069 0000390B 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 41070 0000390D 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 41071 0000390E 43                              inc     bx
 41072                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 41073 0000390F 800E[3C47]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 41074                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 41075 00003914 B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 41076 00003916 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41077 00003918 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 41078 0000391A 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 41079 0000391C 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 41080                                  
 41081                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 41082 0000391E 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 41083 00003921 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 41084                                  	
 41085 00003923 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 41086 00003926 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 41087                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 41088 00003928 BA[744C]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 41089 0000392B E8DD0B                          call    print
 41090                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 41091 0000392E 800E[3C47]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 41092 00003933 EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 41093                                  kbd_notf5:
 41094                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 41095 00003935 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 41096 00003938 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 41097                                  
 41098 0000393A 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 41099 0000393D 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 41100                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 41101 0000393F BA[B24C]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 41102 00003942 E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 41103 00003945 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 41104 00003947 881E[3C47]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 41105                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 41106 0000394B B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 41107 0000394D CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 41108 0000394F C606[4247]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 41109 00003954 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 41110 00003956 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 41111                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 41112 00003958 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 41113 0000395B 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 41114                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 41115 0000395D E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 41116 00003960 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 41117 00003961 C3                              retn			;
 41118                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 41119 00003962 F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 41120 00003963 C3                              retn			;

 41123                                  ;
 41124                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 41125                                  ;
 41126                                  ;   INPUT
 41127                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 41128                                  ;
 41129                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41130                                  ;       None
 41131                                  ;
 41132                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41133                                  ;       None
 41134                                  ;
 41135                                  ;   HISTORY
 41136                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 41137                                  ;
 41138                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41139                                  
 41140                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 41141                                  
 41142                                  set_numlock:
 41143                                          ; 04/01/2023
 41144                                  	;push	ax
 41145 00003964 1E                              push    ds
 41146 00003965 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 41147 00003967 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 41148 00003969 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 41149 0000396C 2E3B06[3C4C]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 41150 00003971 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 41151 00003973 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 41152 00003978 EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 41153                                  not_off:
 41154 0000397A 2E3B06[3A4C]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 41155 0000397F F9                              stc
 41156 00003980 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 41157 00003982 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 41158                                  set_done:
 41159 00003987 1F                              pop     ds
 41160                                  	; 04/01/2023
 41161                                  	;pop	ax
 41162 00003988 C3                              retn

 41166                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41167                                  ;
 41168                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 41169                                  ;
 41170                                  ;   INPUT
 41171                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 41172                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 41173                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 41174                                  ;
 41175                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41176                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 41177                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 41178                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 41179                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 41180                                  ;
 41181                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41182                                  ;       All
 41183                                  ;
 41184                                  ;   NOTES
 41185                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 41186                                  ;
 41187                                  ;   HISTORY
 41188                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 41189                                  ;
 41190                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41191                                  
 41192                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41193                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 41194                                  
 41195                                  menu_check:
 41196                                  
 41197                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 41198                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 41199                                  
 41200 00003989 51                              push    cx              ;
 41201 0000398A 56                              push    si              ;
 41202 0000398B 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 41203                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 41204 0000398D E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 41205 00003990 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 41206 00003992 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 41207 00003994 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 41208 00003996 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 41209 00003997 EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 41210                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 41211 00003999 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 41212 0000399B 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 41213 0000399D 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 41214 0000399F 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 41215 000039A1 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 41216 000039A4 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 41217 000039A9 EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 41218                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 41219 000039AB 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 41220 000039AD 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 41221                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 41222 000039AF E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 41223                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 41224 000039B2 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 41225 000039B4 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 41226 000039B6 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 41227 000039B8 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 41228 000039BA E80807                          call    get_char        ;

 41230 000039BF 3A06[EE1E]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]	; 'N'
 41231 000039C3 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 41232 000039C5 800E[3847]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 41233 000039CA EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 41234                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 41235 000039CC 3A06[FA1E]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]	; 'F'
 41236 000039D0 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 41237 000039D2 800E[3847]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 41238 000039D7 EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 41239                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 41240 000039D9 E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41241 000039DC EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 41242                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 41243 000039DE 5E                              pop     si              ;
 41244 000039DF 59                              pop     cx              ;
 41245                                  
 41246                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 41247                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 41248                                  
 41249 000039E0 F606[3847]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 41250 000039E5 7508                            jnz	short menu_search

 41252                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 41253                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 41254                                  ;

 41256 000039EA 7303                            jnc	short menu_search

 41260

 41265 000039F7 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;

 41268                                  
 41269                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 41270                                  
 41271                                  menu_color:
 41272 00003A01 51                      	push	cx              ;
 41273 00003A02 52                      	push	dx              ;
 41274                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 41275                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41276                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 41277 00003A03 E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 41278 00003A06 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 41279 00003A09 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 41280                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 41281                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 41282                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 41283                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 41284 00003A0B 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 41285 00003A0D E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 41286 00003A10 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 41287 00003A12 E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 41288 00003A15 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 41289 00003A18 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 41290                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41291                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 41292 00003A1A B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 41293 00003A1C D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 41294 00003A1E 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 41295                                  check_color:
 41296 00003A20 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 41297 00003A22 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 41298 00003A24 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 41299                                  set_color:

 41306                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)

 41345 00003A74 EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41346                                  menu_numlock:
 41347 00003A76 E8EBFE                          call    set_numlock
 41348 00003A79 EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41349                                  to_menu_getdefault:

 41351                                  
 41352                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 41353                                  
 41354                                  menu_default:

 41356 00003A81 803E[4247]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 41357 00003A86 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 41358 00003A88 E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 41359 00003A8B 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as

 41364 00003A97 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 41365                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 41366 00003A9A 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 41367 00003A9C B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 41368                                  timeout_ok:                    ;

 41374                                  
 41375                                  menu_item:

 41378 00003AA7 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 41379 00003AA9 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 41380 00003AAB E83303                          call    srch_block      ;

 41383 00003AB1 E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 41384 00003AB4 EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 41385                                  
 41386                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 41387                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 41388                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 41389                                  
 41390                                  menu_itemfound:
 41391 00003AB6 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 41392 00003AB7 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 41393 00003AB9 8887[4347]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 41394 00003ABD 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 41395                                  
 41396                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 41397                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 41398                                  ;   description...
 41399

 41401 00003AC3 89B7[6147]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si

 41403 00003AC9 E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 41404 00003ACC 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41405 00003ACE E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 41406 00003AD1 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41407 00003AD3 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 41408 00003AD5 89BF[6147]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 41409                                  
 41410                                  menu_nextitem:
 41411 00003AD9 E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41412 00003ADC E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 41413                                  
 41414                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 41415                                  
 41416                                  menu_getdefault:
 41417 00003ADF 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 41418 00003AE1 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 41419 00003AE3 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 41420 00003AE5 E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 41421                                  menu_valid:
 41422 00003AE8 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 41423 00003AEA 8816[3E47]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 41424 00003AEE 8B3E[3F47]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 41425 00003AF2 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 41426 00003AF4 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 41427 00003AF6 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 41428                                  menu_chkdefault:
 41429 00003AF7 53                              push    bx              ;
 41430 00003AF8 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 41431 00003AFA 8BB7[4D47]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41432 00003AFE B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 41433 00003B01 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41434 00003B02 06                              push    es              ;
 41435 00003B03 1F                              pop     ds              ;

 41437 00003B07 1F                              pop     ds              ;

 41440 00003B0B 43                              inc     bx              ;
 41441 00003B0C 3A1E[3E47]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 41442 00003B10 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 41443                                  menu_nodefault:
 41444 00003B12 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 41445                                  menu_setdefault:
 41446 00003B14 881E[3D47]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 41447                                  
 41448                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 41449                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 41450                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 41451                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 41452                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 41453                                  ;   with no timeout)
 41454

 41456 00003B1D 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no

 41458 00003B24 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 41459 00003B26 E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 41460                                  
 41461                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 41462                                  
 41463                                  menu_display:
 41464 00003B29 B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 41465 00003B2B CD10                            int     10h             ;

 41467 00003B2F CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41468 00003B31 06                              push    es              ;

 41470 00003B35 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 41471 00003B37 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 41472 00003B3B A3[3A47]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled

 41476 00003B48 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41477 00003B4A B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 41478 00003B4D 8A3E[3347]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 41479 00003B51 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 41480                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 41481 00003B53 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 41482 00003B58 FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 41483                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];

 41485 00003B5F 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 41486 00003B61 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 41487 00003B63 8A36[3747]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 41488                                  menu_clear:

 41490 00003B69 07                              pop     es              ;

 41492 00003B6E BA[EF4C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 41493 00003B71 E89709                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 41494                                  
 41495 00003B74 F606[3847]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 41496 00003B79 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 41497 00003B7B 8A3E[3447]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;

 41499 00003B83 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 41500 00003B85 B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 41501 00003B87 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41502 00003B89 BA[3B4D]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 41503 00003B8C E87C09                          call    print           ;
 41504 00003B8F B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 41505 00003B91 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41506 00003B93 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 41507 00003B96 8816[3647]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 41508                                  
 41509                                  menu_nostatus:
 41510 00003B9A BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 41511                                  menu_disploop:
 41512 00003B9D E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 41513 00003BA0 43                              inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"? because it's a 1-byte opcode
 41514 00003BA1 3A1E[3E47]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 41515 00003BA5 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 41516                                  
 41517                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 41518                                  
 41519 00003BA7 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; select column
 41520 00003BA9 88DE                            mov     dh,bl           ;

 41522 00003BAE 8A3E[3447]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;

 41524 00003BB4 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41525

 41527 00003BB9 E84F09                          call    print           ;

 41529 00003BBF BA[E84A]                        mov     dx,crlfm	
 41530 00003BC2 E84609                          call    print           ;

 41532 00003BC9 800E[3847]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1

 41534 00003BD1 8F06[3847]                      pop     word [bDisableUI]
 41535                                  
 41536                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 41537                                  
 41538                                  menu_autoselect:
 41539 00003BD5 83FBFF                          cmp     bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; clean boot requested?
 41540 00003BD8 7508                            jne	short normal_boot ; no
 41541 00003BDA E8F105                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 41542                                  menu_abort:

 41544 00003BDF E9E400                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 41545                                  
 41546                                  normal_boot:
 41547 00003BE2 83FBFE                          cmp     bx,-2 ; 0FFFEh	; back to top-level menu?
 41548 00003BE5 7509                            jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 41549 00003BE7 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 41550 00003BEB 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 41551 00003BED E9FFFD                          jmp     menu_search
 41552                                  
 41553                                  not_topmenu:
 41554 00003BF0 80BF[4347]4F                    cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 41555 00003BF5 7510                            jne	short not_submenu
 41556 00003BF7 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 41557 00003BF9 8BBF[4D47]                      mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41558 00003BFD E8E101                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 41559 00003C00 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 41560 00003C02 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 41561 00003C04 E929FE                          jmp     menu_found
 41562                                  
 41563                                  not_submenu:
 41564 00003C07 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 41565 00003C09 8B9F[4D47]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41566                                  
 41567                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 41568                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 41569                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 41570                                  
 41571                                  no_selection:
 41572 00003C0D 891E[3F47]                      mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 41573 00003C11 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 41574 00003C15 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 41575 00003C17 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41576 00003C18 8E1E[E714]                      mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 41577 00003C1C 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 41578                                  
 41579                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 41580                                  ;
 41581                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 41582                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 41583                                  ;   within the requested block. Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 41584                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion; the amount of recursion is
 41585                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 41586                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 41587                                  ;
 41588                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 41589                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 41590                                  
 41591                                  copyblock_loop:
 41592 00003C1E 53                              push    bx              ; save selected block name
 41593 00003C1F E82F01                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 41594 00003C22 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 41595 00003C23 7232                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 41596                                  
 41597                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons: it hit eof or a new block
 41598                                  
 41599                                  copyblock_begin:
 41600                                  
 41601                                  ; 10/09/2023
 41602                                  %if 0
 41603                                          push    ax              ;
 41604                                          push    cx              ;
 41605                                          push    si              ;
 41606                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 41607                                          mov     di,szCommon
 41608                                          push    ds              ;
 41609                                          push    cs              ;
 41610                                          pop     ds              ;
 41611                                          call    comp_names      ;
 41612                                          pop     ds              ;
 41613                                          pop     di              ;
 41614                                          pop     si              ;
 41615                                          pop     cx              ;
 41616                                          pop     ax              ;
 41617                                          je	short copyblock_check
 41618                                  %endif
 41619                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41620 00003C25 57                      	push	di
 41621 00003C26 BF[8247]                	mov	di,szCommon	; always do "common" blocks
 41622 00003C29 E81602                  	call	comp_names_x	; (comp_names_safe)
 41623 00003C2C 5F                      	pop	di
 41624 00003C2D 740F                    	je	short copyblock_check
 41625                                  
 41626 00003C2F 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 41627 00003C31 7414                            jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 41628 00003C33 57                              push    di              ;
 41629 00003C34 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 41630 00003C36 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41631 00003C37 06                              push    es              ;
 41632 00003C38 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41633 00003C39 E8E501                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 41634 00003C3C 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41635 00003C3D 5F                              pop     di              ;
 41636                                  copyblock_check:
 41637 00003C3E 7217                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 41638 00003C40 7505                            jne	short copyblock_skip ;
 41639 00003C42 E85A04                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41640 00003C45 EBD7                            jmp	short copyblock_loop
 41641                                  
 41642                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 41643 00003C47 E85504                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 41644 00003C4A E87804                          call    get_char        ;
 41645 00003C4D 7208                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 41646 00003C4F 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 41647 00003C51 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 41648 00003C53 74D0                            je	short copyblock_begin
 41649 00003C55 EBF0                            jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 41650                                  ;
 41651                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 41652                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 41653                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 41654                                  ;
 41655                                  move_config:
 41656 00003C57 89F9                            mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 41657 00003C59 51                              push    cx              ;
 41658                                  ;
 41659                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 41660                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 41661                                  ;
 41662                                   	;mov	cx,7
 41663 00003C5A B90700                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 41664 00003C5D BE[7547]                        mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 41665 00003C60 47                              inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 41666                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 41667                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 41668                                  copy_boot: 
 41669                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 41670 00003C61 2E                              cs
 41671 00003C62 AC                      	lodsb
 41672 00003C63 8805                    	mov     [di],al         ;
 41673 00003C65 47                              inc     di              ;
 41674 00003C66 E2F9                            loop    copy_boot       ;
 41675                                  
 41676 00003C68 06                              push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 41677                                          ;mov	cx,128-7	; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 41678                                  	; 04/01/2023
 41679 00003C69 B179                    	mov	cl,128-7
 41680 00003C6B 2E8B36[3F47]            	mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 41681 00003C70 09F6                            or      si,si           ; valid?
 41682 00003C72 7505                            jnz	short l1	; yes
 41683 00003C74 0E                              push    cs              ;
 41684 00003C75 07                              pop     es              ;
 41685 00003C76 BE[8247]                        mov     si,szCommon
 41686 00003C79 268A04                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 41687 00003C7C E8B205                          call    any_delim       ;
 41688 00003C7F 7406                            je	short l2	;
 41689 00003C81 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 41690 00003C83 46                              inc     si              ;
 41691 00003C84 47                              inc     di              ;
 41692 00003C85 E2F2                            loop    l1              ;
 41693 00003C87 C6050A                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 41694 00003C8A 07                              pop     es              ;
 41695                                  
 41696                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 41697                                  
 41698 00003C8B 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 41699 00003C8D 2E893E[E514]                    mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 41700 00003C92 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 41701 00003C94 59                              pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 41702                                  
 41703 00003C95 51                              push    cx              ;
 41704 00003C96 F3A4                            rep     movsb           ; moved!
 41705 00003C98 59                              pop     cx              ;
 41706 00003C99 8CD8                            mov     ax,ds           ;
 41707 00003C9B 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41708                                  
 41709                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 41710                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 41711                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 41712                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 41713                                  ;   is empty.
 41714                                  
 41715 00003C9C 06                              push    es              ;
 41716 00003C9D 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 41717 00003C9F 46                              inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 41718 00003CA0 26C606000000                    mov     byte [es:0],0	;empty the environment block
 41719 00003CA6 E82600                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 41720 00003CA9 07                              pop     es
 41721                                  
 41722                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 41723                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 41724                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 41725                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 41726                                  
 41727                                  menu_done:
 41728 00003CAA 803E[3447]00                    cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 41729 00003CAF 7415                            je	short menu_exit	;
 41730 00003CB1 06                              push    es              ;
 41731 00003CB2 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 41732 00003CB5 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 41733 00003CB7 A1[3A47]                        mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 41734 00003CBA 26A34E00                        mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 41735 00003CBE A0[3947]                        mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 41736 00003CC1 26A26200                        mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 41737 00003CC5 07                              pop     es              ;
 41738                                  menu_exit:
 41739 00003CC6 890E[5603]                      mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 41740 00003CCA 890E[5803]                      mov     [org_count],cx  ;
 41741                                          ; 10/09/2023 (*) - Erdogan Tan
 41742                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:46D3h
 41743                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:491Ah
 41744                                  	;sub	si,si           ; always return ES:SI pointing to config.sys
 41745 00003CCE C3                      	retn
 41746                                  
 41747                                  ; (*) NOTE: MSDOS 6.0 source code (SYSINIT2.ASM) contains 'sub si,si' at this
 41748                                  ;	position (then 'retn' just after it)
 41749                                  ;	but MSDOS 6.21 and PCDOS 7.1 SYSINITs contain only 'retn' here.
 41750                                  
 41751                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41752                                  ;
 41753                                  ;   copy_envvar:  copy the envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 41754                                  ;
 41755                                  ;   INPUT
 41756                                  ;    ES:SI -> environment variable (in the form "var=string<cr/lf>")
 41757                                  ;
 41758                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41759                                  ;       config_envlen (ie, where to put next envvar) updated appropriately
 41760                                  ;       carry set if error (eg, missing =); clear otherwise
 41761                                  ;
 41762                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41763                                  ;       None
 41764                                  ;
 41765                                  ;   NOTES
 41766                                  ;       None
 41767                                  ;
 41768                                  ;   HISTORY
 41769                                  ;       Created 29-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 41770                                  ;
 41771                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41772                                  
 41773                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41774                                  	; (SYSINIT:46D4h)
 41775                                  
 41776                                  copy_envvar:
 41777 00003CCF 51                              push    cx              ;
 41778 00003CD0 56                              push    si              ;
 41779 00003CD1 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41780 00003CD2 06                              push    es              ;
 41781 00003CD3 06                              push    es              ;
 41782 00003CD4 8E06[E714]                      mov     es,[config_wrkseg] ; ES:DI to point to next available byte
 41783 00003CD8 1F                              pop     ds                 ; DS:SI to point to envvar
 41784                                  
 41785                                  ;   Have to calculate the length of the variable name (and if we hit
 41786                                  ;   the end of the line before we hit '=', then it's curtains for this
 41787                                  ;   config.sys line)
 41788                                  ;
 41789                                  ;   The check for NULL is important because copy_envvar is also used to copy
 41790                                  ;   the initial CONFIG= setting, which will have been zapped by a NULL if no
 41791                                  ;   menu block existed (in order to prevent the creation of an environment)
 41792                                  
 41793 00003CD9 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ;
 41794                                  copy_varlen:                    ;
 41795 00003CDB AC                              lodsb                   ;
 41796 00003CDC 08C0                            or      al,al           ; NULL?
 41797                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 41798 00003CDE 746B                            jz	short copy_envexit ; yes, abort
 41799 00003CE0 3C0D                            cmp     al,cr           ;
 41800                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 41801 00003CE2 7467                            je	short copy_envexit
 41802 00003CE4 3C0A                            cmp     al,lf           ;
 41803                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 41804 00003CE6 7463                            je	short copy_envexit
 41805 00003CE8 41                              inc     cx              ;
 41806 00003CE9 3C3D                            cmp     al,'='          ;
 41807 00003CEB 75EE                            jne	short copy_varlen
 41808 00003CED B000                            mov     al,0            ;
 41809 00003CEF 8A24                            mov     ah,[si]         ; save char after '='
 41810 00003CF1 29CE                            sub     si,cx           ; back up to given varname
 41811 00003CF3 49                              dec     cx              ; CX == # of bytes in varname
 41812 00003CF4 29FF                            sub     di,di           ; start looking for DS:SI at ES:0
 41813                                  copy_varsrch:
 41814 00003CF6 263805                          cmp     byte [es:di],al
 41815 00003CF9 7425                            je	short copy_envprep ; search failed, just copy var
 41816 00003CFB 89FB                            mov     bx,di           ; ES:BX -> start of this varname
 41817 00003CFD 51                              push    cx              ;
 41818 00003CFE 56                              push    si              ;
 41819 00003CFF F3A6                            repe    cmpsb           ;
 41820 00003D01 5E                              pop     si              ;
 41821 00003D02 59                              pop     cx              ;
 41822 00003D03 7531                            jne	short copy_varnext ; no match, skip to next varname
 41823 00003D05 26803D3D                        cmp     byte [es:di],'='
 41824 00003D09 752B                            jne     short copy_varnext ; no match, there's more characters
